Title: Front-End Developer
Description:
Als grootste hotelketen van Nederland zetten wij ons elke dag in om onze gasten te voorzien van een onvergetelijk verblijf. Bij Fletcher zijn we ambitieus en willen we nog verder vooruit. Hoe gaan we dit doen? Hopelijk met jou aan boord! Ter versterking van ons development team zijn we op zoek naar een gedreven Front-end Developer. Je wordt onderdeel van een klein, snelgroeiend ambitieus team, bestaande uit een Product Owner, UI/UX Designer, 2 Full Stack Developers en 2 Back-end Developers.




Kom je bij ons werken als Front-end Developer, dan kom je terecht op ons hoofdkantoor in Nieuwegein: het kloppend hart.

20 minuten met het OV vanaf Utrecht Centraal.
Modern kantoor met verschillende te reserveren werkruimtes.
Zo’n 150 ambitieuze collega’s.
Verse lunch voor een prikkie.
Op vrijdagmiddag even ontspannen met je collega’s, samen met een drankje.




Dit ga je doen:

Jij bent een Front-end Developer met hands-on mentaliteit die snel leert omgaan met nieuwe technieken en frameworks. Je weet als geen ander hoe je verschil kunt maken voor de eindgebruiker. Je houdt tijdens het ontwikkelen rekening met eventuele UX-flaws en weet dit tijdig te overleggen met de rest van je team. Tijdens het bouwen houdt je contact met de Product Owner en Product Designer om de designs zo goed mogelijk uit te bouwen. Daarnaast pak je graag de ruimte voor eigen invulling vanuit jouw rol binnen het team, waarbij je de rest weet te verrassen met creatieve micro-interactions. We zijn bezig met een opmars om onze systemen en websites te vernieuwen en de Tech-stack te moderniseren. Daarom werken wij sinds kort met Laravel voor de Backend en Vue.js met TailwindCSS.




Dit ben jij:

Ervaring met het front-end framework Vue.js.
Je weet hoe state management werkt en kent de component lifecycle van SPA.
Je schrijft HTML, CSS/SCSS en Javascript met je ogen dicht.
Jij hebt ervaring met REST API's.
Jij hebt ervaring met utility-first css frameworks zoals TailwindCSS.
Jij bent zelfstandig, maar ook een echte teamplayer.
Jij hebt ervaring met package managers zoals NPM en Composer.
Jij hebt ervaring met module bundlers (Webpack, Snowpack, Gulp) en CSS Preprocessors (SCSS).
Jij hebt een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal.
Ervaring in één of meer back-end talen zoals PHP is een pre.
Ervaring met Git, Docker en Linux en CI/CD is een pré.
Werken binnen een SCRUM team is een pré.




Dit bieden we jou:

Salaris wordt bepaald op basis van werkervaring en skills.
25 vakantiedagen.
8% vakantiegeld.
Een reiskostenvergoeding van € 0,23 cent per kilometer van 10 kilometer van jouw woonadres.
Ruimte om te werken aan je persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
Een gratis overnachting in één van de ruim 100 Fletcher hotels na het succesvol doorlopen van jouw proeftijd.
Een uniek Fletcher Voordeelpas: Wat dacht je van hoge kortingen op hotelovernachtingen, een dagje wellness met korting, korting op Fletcher Events en meer. Deze voordelen kun je ook delen met je familie en vrienden.
Een goede werksfeer met leuke collega's.
Verschillende mogelijkheden om door te groeien.
Voordelig fietsplan en sporten via Fletcher fitness- en sportabonnement.




*Het salaris is afhankelijk van jouw kennis, ervaring en opleiding.

Show more

Title: Applied Scientist - Pipeline Data Science
Description:
Company Description

Syngenta is one of the world’s leading companies with more than 27.000 employees in over 90 countries dedicated to our purpose: Bringing plant potential to life. Through world-class science, global reach and commitment to our customers we help to increase crop productivity, protect the environment and improve health and quality of life. For more information about us please go to www.syngenta.com.

Job Description

The Seeds Development department for Syngenta seeks a passionate candidate for a full-time position of:

Applied Scientist - Pipeline Data Science

Type: Permanent

Department: Seeds Development / Vegetables

Location: Enkhuizen - The Netherlands

Into action

Do you thrive at the intersection of data engineering, predictive analytics, and innovation? As our Applied Scientist - Pipeline Data Science, you will play a crucial role in designing scalable data solutions that drive actionable insights. By consolidating complex datasets into robust, efficient pipelines, you’ll empower teams to make better decisions and uncover new possibilities in plant breeding. This is your opportunity to work on impactful projects in a collaborative and cutting-edge environment where data drives transformation.

The challenge

Responsibilities

As an Applied Scientist, you’ll focus on building the infrastructure that makes data accessible, reliable, and actionable for diverse stakeholders. Your key responsibilities will include:


Building Scalable Data Pipelines: Design, implement, and optimize data pipelines that integrate and consolidate data from multiple sources, ensuring seamless data flow and availability.
Ensuring Data Quality and Reliability: Develop systems to track, monitor, and maintain the quality, consistency, and integrity of data to ensure robust outputs for analysis and decision-making.
Driving Data Modeling and Mining: Create and implement processes for advanced data modeling and mining to support innovative analytical approaches.
Collaborating Across Teams: Work closely with IT, applied data science teams, and business stakeholders to align data solutions with organizational goals, addressing unique data needs efficiently.
Identify opportunities to incorporate advanced analytics, including machine learning frameworks and cloud platforms to continuously improve predictive pipelines.
Influence adoption of prediction methods, contribute towards their integration in the breeding process and the transformation of breeding schemes


This role combines creativity and problem-solving with a focus on real-world applications. You’ll not only shape the way data is managed but also contribute to meaningful outcomes in plant breeding and sustainable agriculture. Every dataset you refine and every system you enhance will drive smarter decisions and impactful innovations.

Qualifications

Your profile

We’re Looking For a Driven And Detail-oriented Applied Scientist With a Master’s Degree In Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Or a Related Field. You Bring a Strong Mix Of Technical Expertise, Analytical Acumen, And a Collaborative Mindset


Programming: Proficiency in Python, R, and SQL. Experience in both relational and NoSQL databases.
Cloud Proficiency: Familiarity with AWS services and cloud infrastructure
Analytical Acumen: Exceptional analytical skills, with the ability to identify patterns and trends in large and diverse datasets and translate them into meaningful recommendations.
Collaboration & Communication: A strong team player who thrives in cross-functional settings and communicates technical concepts effectively to diverse stakeholders.
Additionally, hands-on experience with containerization tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes) and machine learning frameworks (e.g., Keras, PyTorch, scikit-learn), along with an interest in plant breeding or agricultural innovation, would make you an ideal fit for this role.


Take your chance!

Syngenta is proud of its unique culture and the values that are at the heart of it. We also foster a strong learning culture with plenty of opportunities for personal development. Why? Because our work matters! We offer a competitive salary package, flexible working hours and excellent benefits.

Are you ready to grow your career with us?

If you recognize yourself in this breeder profile and would like to apply for this position, please apply on-line via www.syngenta.com. If you would like to have more information about this vacancy please contact our recruiter Silvana van den Elzen via Silvana.van_den_elzen@syngenta.com or +31 6 82426074.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Overview:

In FRISS, we enable insurers worldwide to automatically detect potential insurance fraud. Our ultimate dream is that the FRISS Score is the global trusted standard for honest insurance. Are you ready for an adventure? We are on the hunt for a Machine Learning Engineer!







Position Overview:

This role offers the flexibility to work from our vibrant office in Utrecht, Netherlands, or remotely from home. As part of our collaborative team, you will have the opportunity to share knowledge and work alongside other AI practitioners.







Key Responsibilities:

Implement scalable and efficient Machine Learning (ML) models.
Contribute to our in-house code libraries following good software development principles and practices.
Deploy our ML models in the cloud and monitor their performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions into products.







Requirements:

Great understanding of and experience in building ML (and deep learning) models.
Excellent programming skills in Python; knowledge in SQL and Py/Spark is a plus.
Hands-on experience with MLOps; CI/CD pipelines, model deployment and monitoring.
Prior work using ML frameworks such as PyTorch (or Keras), Scikit-learn, pandas.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
Excellent communication skills in English.







Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge in Large Language Models (LLMs), efficient ML (quantization, distillation etc.) and transfer learning and fine-tuning.
Experience with Azure Services including Azure Datalake/Datahouse and Azure Databricks.
Experience with Rest API.
Familiarity with containerized (Docker) applications and Kubernetes.







What We Offer:

A stimulating and innovative work environment.
Flexible working options: 50/50 work from our Utrecht office or home.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
A collaborative team culture where knowledge sharing is encouraged.







Apply Now:

If you are ready to play a crucial role at FRISS, we want to hear from you! Apply now via recruitment@friss.com to become our ML Engineer at FRISS and make a meaningful impact on our success.




Please note; We are only accepting applications from candidates based in the Netherlands.







About FRISS:

FRISS is a leading provider in fraud detection and risk mitigation solutions for the insurance industry. Founded in 2006, FRISS holds its head office in Utrecht, The Netherlands, with a global presence and global workforce, including Europe, the United States, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand. Our ultimate dream is that the FRISS Score is the global trusted standard for honest insurance.

To learn more about FRISS, have a look at www.friss.com.

FRISS is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage you to be yourself. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, religious affiliation, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, nationality, or veteran status.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (100% remote - Netherlands)
Description:
Join Tether and Shape the Future of Digital Finance

At Tether, we’re not just building products, we’re pioneering a global financial revolution. Our cutting-edge solutions empower businesses—from exchanges and wallets to payment processors and ATMs—to seamlessly integrate reserve-backed tokens across blockchains. By harnessing the power of blockchain technology, Tether enables you to store, send, and receive digital tokens instantly, securely, and globally, all at a fraction of the cost. Transparency is the bedrock of everything we do, ensuring trust in every transaction.

Innovate with Tether

Tether Finance: Our innovative product suite features the world’s most trusted stablecoin, USDT, relied upon by hundreds of millions worldwide, alongside pioneering digital asset tokenization services.

But that’s just the beginning:Tether Power: Driving sustainable growth, our energy solutions optimize excess power for Bitcoin mining using eco-friendly practices in state-of-the-art, geo-diverse facilities.

Tether Data: Fueling breakthroughs in AI and peer-to-peer technology, we reduce infrastructure costs and enhance global communications with cutting-edge solutions like KEET, our flagship app that redefines secure and private data sharing.

Tether Education: Democratizing access to top-tier digital learning, we empower individuals to thrive in the digital and gig economies, driving global growth and opportunity.

Tether Evolution: At the intersection of technology and human potential, we are pushing the boundaries of what is possible, crafting a future where innovation and human capabilities merge in powerful, unprecedented ways.

Why Join Us?

Our team is a global talent powerhouse, working remotely from every corner of the world. If you’re passionate about making a mark in the fintech space, this is your opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest minds, pushing boundaries and setting new standards. We’ve grown fast, stayed lean, and secured our place as a leader in the industry.

If you have excellent English communication skills and are ready to contribute to the most innovative platform on the planet, Tether is the place for you.

Are you ready to be part of the future?

About The Job

At Tether, we are at the forefront of integrating artificial intelligence with brain-computer interface technologies. Our projects leverage deep learning, generative models, and representation learning to decode and interpret brain activity. With our foundation in both established and cutting-edge AI infrastructure, our mission is to bridge the gap between AI and neuroimaging, driving innovation that’s not only revolutionary but also accessible, transparent, and privacy-focused.

We are looking for a motivated and skilled machine learning engineer to join our dynamic Brain & AI team. This role focuses on developing AI models that enhance our understanding of neural mechanisms and apply this knowledge to real-world applications. You will be instrumental in pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in AI and neuroscience, helping to solve some of the most complex and fascinating challenges in the field today.

Responsibilities:


Develop and evaluate scalable deep learning algorithms that are central to our brain decoding initiatives.
Collaborate closely with data scientists to pioneer research in generative modeling and representation learning.
Identify bottlenecks in data processing pipelines and devise effective solutions, improving performance and reliability.
Maintain high standards of code quality, organization, and automatization across all projects.
Adapt machine learning and neural network algorithms to optimize performance in various computing environments, including distributed clusters and GPUs.


Basic Qualifications:


Strong programming skills in Python, with experience in developing machine learning algorithms or infrastructure using Python and PyTorch.
Experience in deep learning techniques such as supervised, semi-supervised, self-supervised learning, and/or generative modeling.
Proficient in managing unstructured datasets with strong analytic skills.
Demonstrated project management and organizational skills.
Proven ability to support and collaborate with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.


Preferred Qualifications:


Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems, or another quantitative field.
Familiarity with deep learning libraries such as Huggingface, Transformers, Accelerator and Diffuser.
Hands-on experience in training and fine-tuning generative models like diffusion models or large language models such as GPTs and LLAMAs.
Experience with data and model visualization tools.

  • Demonstrated project management and organizational skills.
  • Proven ability to support and collaborate with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.

  • Hands-on experience in training and fine-tuning generative models like diffusion models or large language models such as GPTs and LLAMAs.
  • Experience with data and model visualization tools.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
About Accenture Netherlands

At Accenture, you’ll work on transformative projects that leverage the latest advancements in AI to solve real-world challenges. Collaborate with top talent in the AI field and make a global impact by contributing to the innovation of semiconductor, automotive, healthcare, high-tech, and Finance technologies




About the Role

Are you passionate about cutting-edge AI technologies? Do you want to shape the future of AI applications in one of the most innovative industries? We’re seeking an experienced AI Engineer with expertise in Generative AI and Computer Vision to join our team working on groundbreaking projects for different high-tech companies, one of them is a global leader in semiconductor manufacturing technology.




In this role, you will design, build, and optimize state-of-the-art AI systems, focusing on LLM-based applications, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and agent-based architectures to solve complex business challenges. You’ll collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive AI innovation in mission-critical environments.




Responsibilities

Design, develop, and optimize applications using state-of-the-art large language models (LLMs) and transformer-based architectures.
Build and maintain robust retrieval-augmented generation systems to enhance accuracy and performance of LLMs.
Develop and optimize agent-based workflows for advanced AI solutions.
Build production-grade machine learning pipelines using cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
Work with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into actionable AI solutions.
Evaluate and integrate emerging LLM technologies (e.g., LangChain, LangGraph) into existing systems.
Fine-tune hyperparameters, self-attention mechanisms, and transformer architectures to maximize model efficiency and response quality.
Implement robust testing frameworks and performance evaluation metrics for LLM applications.
Maintain detailed technical documentation, including architecture designs, specifications, and implementation notes.




Requirements

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.
3+ years in AI/ML development, with a strong focus on deep learning.
Proven hands-on experience with transformer-based architectures and RAG implementations.
Demonstrated expertise with deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch and TensorFlow.
Advanced Python programming skills and modern software development practices.
Proficiency in vector databases and frameworks like LangChain and LangGraph.
Experience with cloud-based AI/ML workflows (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Strong understanding of NLP concepts, self-attention mechanisms, and fine-tuning techniques.
Familiarity with version control (Git), CI/CD pipelines, and hyperparameter optimization.
Strong problem-solving abilities, debugging expertise, and excellent communication skills to explain technical concepts.
Experience with building multi-modal AI systems combining generative AI and computer vision.




Accenture Conditions & Benefits:

Contract: Permanent contract
Competitive salary and performance bonuses
Training: Access to continuous learning and development opportunities




If you’re ready to lead the way in AI innovation, send us your resume to carlos.pires@accenture.com

Let’s shape the future together!

Show more
HTML:
About Accenture Netherlands

At Accenture, you’ll work on transformative projects that leverage the latest advancements in AI to solve real-world challenges. Collaborate with top talent in the AI field and make a global impact by contributing to the innovation of semiconductor, automotive, healthcare, high-tech, and Finance technologies


About the Role

Are you passionate about cutting-edge AI technologies? Do you want to shape the future of AI applications in one of the most innovative industries? We’re seeking an experienced AI Engineer with expertise in Generative AI and Computer Vision to join our team working on groundbreaking projects for different high-tech companies, one of them is a global leader in semiconductor manufacturing technology.


In this role, you will design, build, and optimize state-of-the-art AI systems, focusing on LLM-based applications, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and agent-based architectures to solve complex business challenges. You’ll collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive AI innovation in mission-critical environments.


Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and optimize applications using state-of-the-art large language models (LLMs) and transformer-based architectures.
  • Build and maintain robust retrieval-augmented generation systems to enhance accuracy and performance of LLMs.
  • Develop and optimize agent-based workflows for advanced AI solutions.
  • Build production-grade machine learning pipelines using cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
  • Work with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into actionable AI solutions.
  • Evaluate and integrate emerging LLM technologies (e.g., LangChain, LangGraph) into existing systems.
  • Fine-tune hyperparameters, self-attention mechanisms, and transformer architectures to maximize model efficiency and response quality.
  • Implement robust testing frameworks and performance evaluation metrics for LLM applications.
  • Maintain detailed technical documentation, including architecture designs, specifications, and implementation notes.


Requirements

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.
  • 3+ years in AI/ML development, with a strong focus on deep learning.
  • Proven hands-on experience with transformer-based architectures and RAG implementations.
  • Demonstrated expertise with deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch and TensorFlow.
  • Advanced Python programming skills and modern software development practices.
  • Proficiency in vector databases and frameworks like LangChain and LangGraph.
  • Experience with cloud-based AI/ML workflows (AWS, Azure, GCP).
  • Strong understanding of NLP concepts, self-attention mechanisms, and fine-tuning techniques.
  • Familiarity with version control (Git), CI/CD pipelines, and hyperparameter optimization.
  • Strong problem-solving abilities, debugging expertise, and excellent communication skills to explain technical concepts.
  • Experience with building multi-modal AI systems combining generative AI and computer vision.


Accenture Conditions & Benefits:

  • Contract: Permanent contract
  • Competitive salary and performance bonuses
  • Training: Access to continuous learning and development opportunities


If you’re ready to lead the way in AI innovation, send us your resume to carlos.pires@accenture.com

Let’s shape the future together!

Title: Data Science Internship (Responsible AI)
Description:
Welcome to SkillLab

At SkillLab, we envision a world where everyone has a pathway to employment. We enable and lead a radical change - a focus on skill-based approach to employment services. Our AI-driven technology creates more inclusive and efficient labor markets by empowering people to turn their skills into career. SkillLab is working with employment and career services in 25+ countries and seeks to transform labor and education markets globally.

Your opportunity


You will experience the culture of a technology start-up company with a social mission
You will work in an international team with team members from +25 countries and clients across the globe
You will work closely with the data science team and in particular the lead data scientist to take best practices in responsible AI and turn them into actionable improvements for AI model development and deployment



Your team

You will work closely with and report to Aaron, our lead data scientist. You will join our Data Science team where you will also collaborate with our talented and impact-driven people: Rihab, Anna, & Divabelle.

We are proud of the people we work with and excited to work in a company with a social mission. We hope you will be too!

Your impact


You will assist in researching best practices for the development of a Responsible AI framework for SkillLab heavily guided by the EU AI ACT.
You will assist in implementing this research-driven framework in SkillLab's product. In doing so, you will ensure that our product continues to be socially conscious and helpful for our users.
You will proactively document these processes from A-Z to ensure transparency and help improve future processes.



Your Skills


You have a study background in Responsible AI and are familiar with the AI Act
You are familiar with Python, git, SQL
You have experience with machine learning
You are very interested in explainability and transparency approaches to AI
You have a strong attention to details and able to work well both independently when needed and within a team
You are collaborative, possess a learning mindset, and have strong problem solving skills
You are enthusiastic about AI that is socially meaningful and impactful.



Extra awesome


You have experience deploying AI models
Your familiar with Responsible AI requirements outside of the EU



Requirements


You are eligible to work in the Netherlands. We don't support visa applications for applicants outside the EU
You are currently enrolled as a student or graduated within the last 12 months
You are able to commit to a six-month full-time (40 hour/week) internship



Compensation, start-date & location


This is a paid internship. If you live in Amsterdam or relocate to Amsterdam during your internship, then the monthly reimbursement is will be 1.000 EUR
You can do the internship by living in another city in the Netherlands and commuting to the office 1-2 days per week. If you do the internship remotely, then the monthly reimbursement will be 700 EUR. SkillLab covers your train commuting expenses to Amsterdam
We accept applications on rolling basis and we envision a start date as soon as possible



Benefits


You will have a personal learning budget to invest in your professional development
You will have access to mentors & coaches (SkillLab is part of the Google for Startups SDG accelerator)
You will have access to a monthly flexible budget of benefits via Alleo app. You can spend this budget on a large selection of providers, ranging from gym memberships to bike subscriptions and online stores
You will join our bi-annual company offsite retreats in different locations like Belgium, the Netherlands etc



Our selection procedure


You apply for the role and we review your profile
We will invite you for a short screening call
We will invite you for a 60min interview if we find that you are a good fit. The interview will involve you preparing a short assignment
We will offer you the internship and discuss logistics, if we think that you are the ideal candidate for the role



What else to know?


This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the internship position and may be subject to change based on the organization's requirements and priorities
If this job is not for you, perhaps you have a friend who might be a good fit. Send them this job posting!
Learn what it's like to be an intern at SkillLab: https://skilllab.io/en-us/news/whats-it-like-coffee-with-the-interns
Get 3 tips for your job application at SkillLab: https://skilllab.io/en-us/news/skilllabjobapplication
SkillLab is committed to diversity, equality and inclusion at the workplace. We welcome applications of candidates from all backgrounds. Read more about DEI at SkillLab: https://skilllab.io/en-us/news/diversity-equity-and-inclusion-at-skilllab

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
The focus of the work will be developing, improving, and maintaining data science, machine learning, and data engineering models. Specifically, the data science will focus on Sales and Services Forecasting. In addition to the science and the tech, this will require the exploration and study of logistics planning processes within supply chain. Communication with diverse stakeholders is expected and crucial to identify key factors impacting logistic operations.




Requirements:




Experience in forecasting problems and affinity with logistics and supply chain domain.
Strong scientific background, business domain curiosity and proactive communication skills.
Ability to write production-ready Python code, review PRs, and contribute to maintainable, usable, and extendable codebases.
Experience with Machine Learning libraries and frameworks (e.g., XGBoost, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Strong knowledge of cloud services, especially Google Cloud Platform (GCP), including Cloud Storage or BigQuery.
Familiarity with open-source MLOps tools like Metaflow, BentoML, KubeFlow, or similar.
Confidence in digging into code and understanding how things are working.
Demonstrated ability to apply analytical findings to real-world business problems.
Excellent problem-solving skills with a strategic mindset.Ideally, knowledge of Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform, automated testing and CI/CD tools like GitHub Actions.
Ability to work in cross-functional teams with product owners, data scientists, backend engineers, and frontend engineers.




What 3 things from above are most important?




Experience in forecasting problems especially in logistics and supply chain.
Affinity with software engineering practices in the data science space.
Cross-functional collaboration and teamwork.

Title: Data Scientist Traineeship
Description:
Summer traineeship 2025

Are you a talented and ambitious final-year master's student ready to kickstart your career in trading? Then you should apply to WEBB Traders’ summer traineeship!

WEBB Traders is a global proprietary trading firm powered by data and technology. Since 2009, we’ve been adding liquidity to financial markets through cutting-edge strategies in cash equity and derivatives. Headquartered in Amsterdam with a growing presence in Paris, our diverse team of 70 professionals from 20+ nationalities shares one goal: becoming a global leading trading firm.

As we continue to grow, we're launching our summer traineeship program, offering you the chance to gain hands-on experience on impactful projects. For eight exciting weeks, you’ll collaborate with our teams to tackle complex challenges and create innovative solutions that push our business forward. This immersive experience will equip you with industry insights, practical skills, and a solid foundation for your future career.

Highlights of the Program


Create an impact in existing projects: Tackle meaningful assignments that make a difference, guided by our senior team members.
Collaborative environment: Work alongside skilful colleagues in a supportive and fun team setting.
Unique onboarding experience: Kick off your journey with a memorable trip to Paris where you will meet our French team. Not only will you gain firsthand insight into our trading operations, but you will also have the opportunity to explore the vibrant sights and culture of Paris with your fellow colleagues.



The Summer Traineeship runs from July 1st to August 22nd* and we’ll be hiring for three dynamic areas: Software Engineer, Risk Analyst, and Data Scientist. You can find more information about the specific requirements for each role below.

Ready to take the first step toward your trading career? Apply now and seize this unique opportunity!


If you are being hired for the Summer Traineeship, we expect you to join the full program. If these dates don’t align with your schedule, you can send us an open application for an internship. We are open to consider different time frames during the academic year.



Data Scientist Traineeship

WEBB Traders is looking for a final year master student to join our Risk team. You’ll play a role in elevating our risk management function to the next level. Collaborating on critical initiatives, you’ll develop world-class risk tools that identify weaknesses and opportunities, keeping the company safe while transforming controls into a strategic advantage.

Join us to kick-start your career in the unique trading culture of openness and boundary-free entrepreneurship!

Choose your challenge

Together with your mentor, you’ll work on a project besides taking part in the day-to-day tasks of the team. You will be building Python tooling for:


Analysis
Building an in-house historical finance database
Creating real-time finance and treasury dashboards



Your role


Build risk, finance operations and compliance dashboards
Visualise risk, finance, operations and compliance data to relevant stakeholders
Analyse complex business problems and propose solutions or enhancements
Provide clear, timely updates on planning and delivery. Monitor and manage continuous process improvements, addressing outstanding issues
Respond to ad hoc requests from stakeholders



Who are you


You’re in your last year of mathematics, physics, econometrics, quantitative finance, data science
You have strong analytical skills
You have a strong interest in equities, derivatives, commodities, algorithmic trading, high-frequency trading, market making and risk management
You have great Python and SQL skills
You are fluent in English, both spoken and written



What we offer


Challenge yourself. Be part of the dynamic work environment and grow along with us.
Team up. A great office vibe in the heart of Amsterdam
Keep the spirit up. Fun activities with your teammates on a regular basis and Friday drinks
Treat yourself. Enjoy healthy and delicious meals delivered by Alma Sustainable Catering
Stay fit. Sports facility access via ClassPass
It’s on us. Travel costs reimbursement if you don’t own a student public transport card
And finally… an attractive compensation package!



Application process


Apply on our WEBBsite!
Initial screening with a recruiter to assess motivation and cultural fit
Complete a skill-based technical test
In-depth interview with senior team members to evaluate your test results
Leadership or panel interview to assess overall fit and long-term potential
Accept our offer!



____________________________________________________________________________________

When you apply to this vacancy and attach your resume, you hereby give consent to the processing of your personal data that you have provided, and you declare your agreement with storing this data for a period of 6 months, in accordance with the GDPR law and regulations. After that period, your personal data will be automatically deleted from our databases, unless we obtain your explicit and informed consent to retain it for a longer period. All the personal data collected will be used by WEBB Traders employees, who require access to this data on account of their position, exclusively for recruitment purposes. These employees are bound by confidentiality obligations and will use your personal data only as necessary to evaluate your job application. If we wish to retain your personal data for a longer period of time, for example for future job opportunities, we will ask for your explicit and informed consent to retain your data. You can revoke your consent at any time by contacting us, and we will immediately delete any personal information we hold about you. By submitting your application, you acknowledge that you have been informed about your rights under the GDPR, including your right to access, rectify, or erase your personal data, your right to restrict or object to the processing of your personal data, and your right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority. Finally, we would like to assure you that we take the security and confidentiality of your personal data very seriously, and we have implemented appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure their protection. If you have any questions or concerns about our data processing activities, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Do you enjoy working with innovative research technology?

Would you like to be part of a team that creates solutions for our customers?







About our Team




LexisNexis Legal & Professional, which serves customers in more than 150 countries with 11,800 employees worldwide, is part of RELX, a global provider of information-based analytics and decision tools for professional and business customers. Our company has been a long-time leader in deploying AI and advanced technologies to the legal market to improve productivity and transform the overall business and practice of law, deploying ethical and powerful generative AI solutions with a flexible, multi-model approach that prioritizes using the best model from today’s top model creators for each individual legal use case.




About the Role




As a Data Scientist, you will extract insights from large, complex datasets using diverse analysis techniques. You'll use data preparation, modeling, and visualization to solve intricate business problems.




Extracts knowledge and insights from high volume, high dimensional data in order to investigate complex business problems through a range of data preparation, modeling, analysis and/or visualization techniques, which may include statistical analysis, predictive modeling and pattern recognition | Typically uses existing data platforms and tools (ERP/CRM systems, relational or NoSQL databases, data analysis and visualization software) but may also use object-oriented programming to develop own scripts and visualizations.




A Data Scientist II should have a basic understanding of best-practice and can execute the methods for projects with supervision. Individuals in this role will continue to provide support to the Data Scientist team members and also begin to lead some analytic efforts.







Responsibilities




Extracting knowledge and insights from high volume, high dimensional data
Investigating complex business problems through data preparation, modeling, and analysis
Utilizing statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and pattern recognition techniques
Using existing data platforms and tools for data analysis and visualization
Developing own scripts and visualizations using object-oriented programming
Providing support to senior Data Scientists and leading some analytic efforts
Pulling data, cleaning data, and maintaining datasets and models
Participating in result presentation to internal stakeholders




Requirements




Hold at least a bachelor's degree in a relevant field
Have a solid background of relevant work experience or a master's degree in a related field.
Be experienced in NLP and classic machine learning frameworks (pandas, scikit, etc)
Possess good SQL skills and practical knowledge of XML
Demonstrate a basic understanding of best practices in data science
Be able to execute methods for projects with supervision
Have practical experience with ERP/CRM systems, relational or NoSQL databases
Be capable of utilizing data analysis and visualization software




Work in a way that works for you




We promote a healthy work/life balance across the organisation. We offer an appealing working prospect for our people. With numerous wellbeing initiatives, shared parental leave, study assistance and sabbaticals, we will help you meet your immediate responsibilities and your long-term goals.




Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive




Working for you




We know that your well-being and happiness are key to a long and successful career. These are some of the benefits we are delighted to offer:




Dutch Share Purchase Plan
Annual Profit Share Bonus
Comprehensive Pension Plan
Home, office or commuting allowance
Generous vacation entitlement and option for sabbatical leave
Maternity, Paternity, Adoption and Family Care leave
Flexible working hours
Personal Choice budget
Variety of online training courses and career roadshows
Wellbeing programs and gym facility in the office
Internal communities and networks
Various employee discounts
Recruitment introduction reward
Work from anywhere
Employee Assistance Program (global)
Annual Event




About the Business




LexisNexis Legal & Professional® provides legal, regulatory, and business information and analytics that help customers increase their productivity, improve decision-making, achieve better outcomes, and advance the rule of law around the world. As a digital pioneer, the company was the first to bring legal and business information online with its Lexis® and Nexis® services.

  • Be experienced in NLP and classic machine learning frameworks (pandas, scikit, etc)
  • Possess good SQL skills and practical knowledge of XML
  • Demonstrate a basic understanding of best practices in data science
  • Be able to execute methods for projects with supervision
  • Have practical experience with ERP/CRM systems, relational or NoSQL databases
  • Be capable of utilizing data analysis and visualization software


Work in a way that works for you


We promote a healthy work/life balance across the organisation. We offer an appealing working prospect for our people. With numerous wellbeing initiatives, shared parental leave, study assistance and sabbaticals, we will help you meet your immediate responsibilities and your long-term goals.


  • Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive


Working for you


We know that your well-being and happiness are key to a long and successful career. These are some of the benefits we are delighted to offer:


  • Dutch Share Purchase Plan
  • Annual Profit Share Bonus
  • Comprehensive Pension Plan
  • Home, office or commuting allowance
  • Generous vacation entitlement and option for sabbatical leave
  • Maternity, Paternity, Adoption and Family Care leave
  • Flexible working hours
  • Personal Choice budget
  • Variety of online training courses and career roadshows
  • Wellbeing programs and gym facility in the office
  • Internal communities and networks
  • Various employee discounts
  • Recruitment introduction reward
  • Work from anywhere
  • Employee Assistance Program (global)
  • Annual Event


About the Business


LexisNexis Legal & Professional® provides legal, regulatory, and business information and analytics that help customers increase their productivity, improve decision-making, achieve better outcomes, and advance the rule of law around the world. As a digital pioneer, the company was the first to bring legal and business information online with its Lexis® and Nexis® services.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
At Freeday, we aim to unlock human potential by leveraging disruptive technologies and building an AI-powered digital workforce that excels in repetitive tasks. By automating these tasks, we allow people to focus on more creative, rewarding work. We are a young, fast-growing IT company with a dynamic, no-nonsense culture. Located in the heart of Rotterdam, our team is driven by innovation, collaboration, and a passion for AI's potential to change the world.

Freeday is looking for a motivated Machine Learning Engineer to join our fast-growing AI team. This is an exciting opportunity to take your career to the next level by working on innovative machine-learning solutions that power our automated services. You will be involved in the development, deployment, and optimization of machine learning models, all within a supportive environment that encourages growth and learning.




As a Machine Learning Engineer at Freeday, you'll be surrounded by forward-thinking, innovative minds and cutting-edge AI technologies. Whether you’ve had 1 or 3 years of experience, we want someone who’s eager to learn, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and contribute to the projects that will shape the future of automation.

Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and implement machine learning models to drive our automated services.
Collaborate closely with product and engineering teams to define project objectives and align machine learning efforts with business goals.
Optimize machine learning algorithms for scalability and performance.
Contribute to the deployment of machine learning models in production environments using MLOps practices.
Continuously learn and adapt to new machine learning techniques and tools.
Take ownership of your projects while working in close collaboration with more senior team members for guidance and support.




What We Offer:

A dynamic, fast-growing, and innovative work environment.
A competitive salary and pension plan.
Opportunities for professional development, including learning new machine learning techniques and tools.
A fun, inclusive, and collaborative team culture with regular social events, sports activities, and team-building opportunities.
The chance to work on impactful projects that automate workflows and unlock human potential.
A company laptop to support your work effectively.
Room for growth, initiative, and the chance to make a real difference within the team




Our Culture:




At Freeday, we’re not just about the work—we’re about you. We embrace a collaborative and innovative culture where ideas flow freely, and everyone is encouraged to take ownership. Whether you’re developing machine learning models or learning new skills, you’ll be part of a supportive environment where growth and personal development are key.




Requirements:

1-3 years of experience in machine learning or a related role, preferably in the tech sector.
Strong programming skills in Python and a good understanding of popular ML frameworks (such as TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Basic familiarity with cloud technologies like AWS or Google Cloud.
Some experience or familiarity with MLOps tools like MLflow or Kubeflow is a plus.
You enjoy tackling challenges, are not afraid to take initiative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Passionate about automation, AI, and the potential of technology to solve real-world problems.
Great communication skills and a team-oriented mindset.




***

We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
My client within the international freight space in Amsterdam are looking for an experienced data scientist to join their international logistics team.




Responsibilities:




- Collecting and interpreting data from multiple sources, both internal and external.

- Cleaning and validating data to ensure accuracy, completeness, and reliability.

- Analyzing complex datasets using statistical methods and data visualization tools.

- Developing and maintaining databases, data systems, and dashboards for reporting purposes.

- Identifying trends, patterns, and correlations in data sets to support business objectives.

- Creating comprehensive reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.

- Integrate machine learning and artificial intelligence into the everyday workflow of the business




Requirements:




• Strong academic background. Ideally a masters in a related field (data science, computer science, econometrics, mathematics etc.)

• Strong Python and SQL skills

• Knowledge of PowerBI is ideal but not required

• Experience with machine learning models is a plus

• Experience with stakeholder management is a plus but not required




Salary Package:




• Up to €90,000 per annum (D.O.E)

• Travel allowance

• Hybrid working and flexible working hours (2 days in office)

• Digital nomad policy (can work multiple weeks of the year abroad)

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Are you a Machine Learning enthusiast passionate about turning data into actionable insights and building scalable solutions? Join a forward-thinking company in the vibrant city of Rotterdam, leading the way in innovation with market leading platforms for analytics, machine learning, and real-time processing.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, build, and optimize machine learning models to solve complex business challenges.
Develop and maintain scalable pipelines to support training, evaluation, and deployment of ML models.
Collaborate with data engineers, scientists, and business stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver impactful ML solutions.
Implement robust monitoring and retraining pipelines to ensure model accuracy and performance.
Stay at the forefront of the field, exploring new ML techniques and technologies to enhance the organization’s capabilities.




Requirements:

Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
2+ years in a Machine Learning Engineer or related role.
Hands-on experience building and deploying machine learning models in production.
Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
Experience with orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, Prefect).
Knowledge of MLOps practices for managing the ML lifecycle.




What We Offer:

Competitive salary up to €90,000 gross per year.
Flexible hybrid working model with 2 days in the Rotterdam office.
Comprehensive benefits package, including a generous pension plan, mobility budget, and a dedicated training budget.
A collaborative, inclusive work environment with opportunities for professional growth.
A modern office in the heart of Rotterdam, easily accessible by public transport.




If you’re passionate about building scalable ML solutions and want to be at the forefront of innovation, we’d love to hear from you!




📧 Email: euan.mccaul-gallimore@vividresourcing.com




📞 Call: +31 (0) 203 997 864

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist based in Amsterdam, for a hybrid role, including predictive analysis and machine learning within the logistics and supply chain industry.




As a critical member of our team, you'll be central in solving complex data problems and exploiting data-driven solutions. The ideal candidate has a knack for interpreting complex datasets, a curiosity in business domain, and can construct valuable insights to drive strategic improvement.




Tasks and Responsibilities:

1. Solve complex data problems and provide insight into the supply chain and logistics processes.

2. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and implement data-driven solutions.

3. Write maintainable, usable, and extendable production-level Python code.

4. Leverage Machine Learning libraries and frameworks like XGBoost, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch.

5. Manage and optimize cloud services, with an emphasis on Google Cloud Platform.




Qualifications and Skills:

1. Proven experience working as a Data Scientist, preferably in a forecasting role within the supply chain/logistics industry.

2. Proficient in Python programming and reviewing PRs.

3. Experience with Machine Learning libraries and frameworks.

4. Strong knowledge of cloud services, preferably Google Cloud Platform, including Cloud Storage or BigQuery.

5. Familiarity with open-source MLOps tools like Metaflow, BentoML, KubeFlow, or similarly.

6. Knowledge of Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform, automated testing and CI/CD tools like GitHub Actions is a plus.

7. Excellent problem-solving skills with a strategic mindset.

8. Strong scientific background and business domain curiosity.

9. Proactive communication skills and the ability to engage cohesively with team members across multiple functions.




As a Data Scientist in our organization, you will be at the forefront of analytics and help drive strategic decision-making to improve and grow our value proposition. You will be working in a cross-functional team, collaborating closely with product owners, data scientists, backend engineers, and frontend engineers.




Your experience and drive will play a major role in shaping the future of our logistics and supply chain operations. Come, join us on this exciting journey!

Your experience and drive will play a major role in shaping the future of our logistics and supply chain operations. Come, join us on this exciting journey!

Title: Front-end developer
Description:
De organisatie:

Deze organisatie is een ‘’Brabants’’ familiebedrijf dat verschillende uitdagende (web)oplossingen ontwikkeld, verkoopt en implementeert. Ze werken vanuit een gezellige thuisbasis en het team bestaat momenteel uit zo’n 15 collega’s. Waaronder 3 developers, 3 productmanagers, collega’s van helpdesk, communicatie en consultancy. Momenteel zijn ze op zoek naar een evraren developer die hun kan versterken in de diverse uitdagingen. Zo staan ze aan de vooravond van een volledige herbouw, waarbij er veel ruimte is voor jouw ideeën en inbreng. Er zijn korte lijnen en ze kennen geen bureaucratie of suffe processen. En ze zijn niet vies van experimenteren, wat werkt passen ze toe en ze nemen afscheid van zaken die er niet (meer) toe doen. Je komt terecht in een hecht team met vrijheid, een leuke werksfeer en goede zorg voor de medewerkers.




Momenteel richten ze zich met name op de 3 grootste oplossingen. Een financieel pakket voor grote retailers zoals Nelson schoenen, Actiesport en Scapino, een slimme webapp die wordt gebruikt binnen de gehandicaptenzorg en een totaaloplossing voor bewind voering (vanaf 300 tot 2.500 cliënten). Hiernaast bieden ze sinds enige tijd ook eigen Hosting diensten aan voor hun partners. Vanuit hun kennis en ervaring denken ze proactief mee in de digitalisering bij hun klanten. En omdat ze vanuit een klein team werken gebeurt alles in één ontwikkelomgeving. Zo zetten ze generieke applicaties op met veel flexibele mogelijkheden. Vanwege het type klanten zijn ze ISO gecertificeerd en ze hechten dan ook veel waarde aan security e.d.




De functie:

Ze zijn op zoek naar een (medior of senior) developer met de focus op front-end. In hun opzet hebben ze geen losse UI schermen maar word het aangestuurd vanuit de database + HTML. Ze hebben onlangs een proof of concept opgezet in Svelte en zijn ze op zoek naar een developer die in staat is generiek te denken. Je werkt samen met je team volgens een gestructureerde manier (Agile) en bent in staat om mee te denken aan toekomstbestendige architecturen, tools en componenten. Je kunt je goed verplaatsen in de eindgebruikers en hebt gevoel voor User Experience.




Eisen:

HBO/ WO werk- en denkniveau
Je hebt minimaal 5 jaar relevante kennis/ ervaring
Je bent in staat abstract te denken
Je hebt ruime ervaring met JavaScript frameworks
Kennis/ervaring in Svelte is een grote pré
Je hebt ervaring met het ontwikkelen en gebruiken van webservices/API’s
Goede beheersing van zowel de Nederlandse als de Engelse taal in woord en geschrift




Aanbod:

Salarisindicatie € 4.500 tot € 6.000, - bruto per maand (o.b.v. kennis en ervaring)
Mobiliteitsvergoeding van € 700,- bruto per maand (te besteden aan een auto of bruto uit te keren boven op je salaris)
Een contract voor 28 tot 40 uur per week
Een goede pensioenregeling
Reiskostenvergoeding
28 vakantiedagen
8% salaris
Hybride werken (3 dagen kantoor, 2 dagen vanuit huis)
Laptop (iOS of Windows)
Gratis verzorgde lunch
Ruime voor persoonlijke en professionele groei
Regelmatig leuke uitjes, en een gezellig team!




Enthousiast?

Voor meer informatie en om te solliciteren op deze functie kun je reageren via onderstaande contactgegevens.




Contactgegevens

Mark Blanken – Principal Consultant PHP | Python | Front-end & UX/UI Design

Mark@starapple.nl / 088- 321 8 123 / 06-13646755 / www.starapple.nl

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
For one of our clients we are currently looking for an Gen-AI engineer that will be involved with atomising their customer service department.




Responsibilities

Build and fine-tune Generative AI models (e.g., OpenAI GPT, BERT, Llama, etc.) tailored to automate customer service workflows.
Design solutions for automating responses, sentiment analysis, intent recognition, and personalized customer interactions.
Develop NLP pipelines to handle multi-lingual queries, context retention, and conversational AI tasks.
Optimize chatbots and virtual assistants to provide accurate, real-time resolutions.
Integrate AI models into existing customer service platforms such as CRM systems, ticketing tools, and live chat applications.
Ensure seamless deployment of AI solutions, maintaining scalability and reliability.




Qualifications

Strong experience in Generative AI tools and frameworks (e.g., OpenAI, Hugging Face, LangChain).
Proficiency in programming languages like Python, Java, or similar.
Deep understanding of NLP, machine learning (ML), and deep learning (DL) concepts.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and AI/ML services.
Familiarity with conversational AI frameworks such as Dialogflow, Rasa, or Microsoft Bot Framework.
Knowledge of the Cloud particularly with Azure.




| Job Details |

Start Date: ASAP
Freelance or on Payroll basis
Hybrid Setting (36 hours)




For inquiries, contact Alexander Mungkorn, Delivery Consultant, at alexander.mungkorn@mbanl.com.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
My Client located in Amsterdam are in search of a highly skilled machine learning engineer to join their team. The main responsibilities and requirements are listed below !




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement machine learning algorithms to solve complex problems in a variety of domains 📈🧠.
Work with large datasets, preprocess and clean data to build robust models 🗂️🔍.
Design, train, and fine-tune machine learning models for tasks such as classification, regression, clustering, and recommendation systems 🤖📊.
Experiment with and optimize algorithms to improve model accuracy, efficiency, and scalability ⚙️📈.
Deploy machine learning models into production environments and monitor their performance in real-time 🚀🔧.
Document methodologies, results, and processes to maintain clear communication within the team 📝💬.




Key Requirements:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field 🎓📘.
Proven experience in machine learning, deep learning, and AI, with a solid understanding of ML algorithms and frameworks 🧠📊.
Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or C++ 💻💡.
Hands-on experience with machine learning libraries like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Scikit-learn, or similar 🔧📚.
Experience with data manipulation and analysis using libraries like Pandas, NumPy, or similar 📂🔍.
Knowledge of model deployment techniques (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, cloud platforms) ☁️⚙️.
Familiarity with cloud-based machine learning services (e.g., AWS Sagemaker, Google AI Platform, Azure ML) is a plus ☁️🚀.




Salary Package:

Up to €85,000
Flexible Hybrid Working
Company Car
Laptop and Mobile Phone

Show more
HTML:
My Client located in Amsterdam are in search of a highly skilled machine learning engineer to join their team. The main responsibilities and requirements are listed below !


Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and implement machine learning algorithms to solve complex problems in a variety of domains 📈🧠.
  • Work with large datasets, preprocess and clean data to build robust models 🗂️🔍.
  • Design, train, and fine-tune machine learning models for tasks such as classification, regression, clustering, and recommendation systems 🤖📊.
  • Experiment with and optimize algorithms to improve model accuracy, efficiency, and scalability ⚙️📈.
  • Deploy machine learning models into production environments and monitor their performance in real-time 🚀🔧.
  • Document methodologies, results, and processes to maintain clear communication within the team 📝💬.


Key Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field 🎓📘.
  • Proven experience in machine learning, deep learning, and AI, with a solid understanding of ML algorithms and frameworks 🧠📊.
  • Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or C++ 💻💡.
  • Hands-on experience with machine learning libraries like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Scikit-learn, or similar 🔧📚.
  • Experience with data manipulation and analysis using libraries like Pandas, NumPy, or similar 📂🔍.
  • Knowledge of model deployment techniques (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, cloud platforms) ☁️⚙️.
  • Familiarity with cloud-based machine learning services (e.g., AWS Sagemaker, Google AI Platform, Azure ML) is a plus ☁️🚀.


Salary Package:

  • Up to €85,000
  • Flexible Hybrid Working
  • Company Car
  • Laptop and Mobile Phone

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Bedrijfsomschrijving

Een positieve toekomst voor iedereen, daar werken we bij Sopra Steria aan. Met meer dan 56.000 collega’s in 30 landen zijn we Europa’s toonaangevende aanbieder van digitale oplossingen. Wij geloven dat het niet alleen technologie is die transformatie aandrijft, maar dat mensen de kern vormen van verandering. Daarom staan mensen centraal in alles wat we doen, zowel individueel als in teamverband. De wereld is hoe we haar vormgeven. Laten we haar samen vormgeven.

Vacatureomschrijving

Grote datasets bevatten waardevolle inzichten. Als data scientist zul je deze inzichten ontsluiten met behulp van je vaardigheid in programmeertalen zoals Python en R, evenals visualisatietools zoals Tableau en Power BI. Je zult deze inzichten communiceren naar stakeholders, zodat we die data kunnen omzetten in actie. Van jou wordt verwacht dat je de meest efficiënte oplossing analyseert en identificeert, terwijl je aandacht besteedt aan de details. Onze data scientists zijn bedreven in Hadoop & Spark, en cloudplatformen zoals AWS en Azure. Deze tools, gecombineerd met jouw data-expertise, zouden het bouwen van voorspellende modellen, het uitvoeren van hypothesetests en het doen van verkennende data-analyse tot een tweede natuur moeten maken.

Als Data Scientist bij Sopra Steria duik je de wereld van Kunstmatige Intelligentie (AI) in. Je past je vaardigheden toe op echte scenario's en in verschillende domeinen, zoals de ontdekking en analyse van betalingsstromen bij overheidsinstanties, fraudedetectie bij banken, de ontwikkeling van aanbevelingssystemen in de retailsector en de optimalisatie van toeleveringsketens.

We zijn actief in thema's zoals Natural Language Processing (NLP), Computer Vision, Machine Learning Operations (MLOps), AIOps en Uitlegbare AI (XAI). Je zult de ontwikkeling en implementatie van oplossingen met Machine Learning & Deep Learning bij onze klanten uitvoeren en de kwaliteit en prestaties van bestaande voorspellende modellen beoordelen, tot en met het in productie brengen en het behouden van deze modellen.

Functie-eisen

We zijn op zoek naar gepassioneerde collega’s die graag de grenzen van digitale transformatie en technologieconsulting verleggen. Bij Sopra Steria krijg je de kans om je vaardigheden verder te ontwikkelen in een constructieve, samenwerkende teamomgeving, waarbij je werkt aan impactvolle projecten die verandering teweegbrengen voor onze klanten. Als je gedijt in een uitdagende omgeving en voldoet (tenzij anders vermeld) aan de meeste kwalificaties hieronder, kijken we uit naar je sollicitatie!

Type dienstverband: Hybride

Locatie: Nieuwegein

Aantal contracturen: 32-40 uur per week

Contracttype: Vast

Opleiding: Je hebt een HBO- of WO-opleiding afgerond in de richting van IT

Talen: Nederlands (vereist) en Engels

Ervaring in de meeste van de volgende Data Science technieken:


Begeleide en onbegeleide leeralgoritmes
Diepgaande leertechnieken
Anomaliedetectie
Aanbevelingssystemen
Natuurlijke taalverwerking
Computer vision en reinforcement learning
Autoencoders, transformers, voorspellingen


Ervaring in een van de volgende programmeertalen:


Python
R


Ervaring in het in productie brengen van Data Science-oplossingen/software (Azure, AWS, GCP, Kubernetes, Docker, etc.)

Ervaring met het bouwen en implementeren van geavanceerde analytische oplossingen en het kunnen leveren van referentiecases

Diepgaande kennis van open-source software en bibliotheken in Python en/of R voor machine- en deep learning

Ervaring met big data en platforms zoals Azure Machine Learning Services en Amazon SageMaker is een voordeel.

Aanvullende informatie

Als onderdeel van een van Europa’s grootste aanbieders van digitale oplossingen profiteer je van uitgebreide carrièremogelijkheden, zowel lokaal als internationaal. Bij de Sopra Steria Academy maak je deel uit van een dynamisch netwerk van 56.000 professionals in verschillende stadia van hun loopbaan.

Je wordt onderdeel van een toonaangevende techspeler in Europa, erkend voor zijn consultancy, digitale diensten en softwareontwikkeling. Binnen onze Oracle Area bieden wij uitgebreide beheerdiensten voor alle Oracle-producten, waaronder SaaS, PaaS, IaaS, on-premise databases, middleware en Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. Onze expertise garandeert dat jouw Oracle-omgevingen geoptimaliseerd, veilig en soepel draaiend blijven.

Naast beheerdiensten bieden we consultancy op maat. Of je nu behoefte hebt aan doorlopend beheer of ondersteuning bij specifieke projecten, ons team staat klaar om je doelen met Oracle-technologieën te realiseren.

Onze medewerkers staan bekend om hun gedurfde keuzes en het leveren van resultaten. Werk samen met hooggekwalificeerde professionals die voorop lopen in bedrijfs-softwareoplossingen en innovatie bij Europa's toonaangevende aanbieder van digitale diensten.

Wij bieden een aantrekkelijk arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket, waaronder:


Locatie onafhankelijk en flexibel werken;
Onbeperkte ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden;
Een laptop, telefoon en thuiskantoor;
Een aantrekkelijk salaris;
Keuze tussen een bedrijfsauto of een mobiliteitsbudget;
De mogelijkheid om je eigen voordelen aan te passen via Flex Benefits:
Vakantiegeld en winstdeling;
27 verlofdagen (20 wettelijke en 7 bovenwettelijke vakantiedagen).

______

Sopra Steria is een werkgever die gelijke kansen biedt. Alle gekwalificeerde sollicitanten worden in aanmerking genomen voor een job zonder rekening te houden met leeftijd, afkomst, nationaliteit, huidskleur, verlof voor familie- of medische zorg, geslachtsidentiteit of -uitdrukking, genetische informatie, immigratiestatus, burgerlijke staat, medische toestand, nationale herkomst, fysieke of mentale handicap, politieke voorkeur, beschermde veteranen- of militaire status, ras, etniciteit, religie, geslacht (inclusief zwangerschap), seksuele geaardheid of enig ander kenmerk dat wordt beschermd door toepasselijke lokale wetten, voorschriften en verordeningen. We koesteren een werkomgeving die inclusief is en alle verschillen respecteert.

Title: DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
Ga aan de slag bij Wetterskip Fryslân en duik in de uitdagende wereld van het waterbeheer. Als Wetterskipper krijg je vertrouwen, verantwoordelijkheid en de ruimte om je werk op jouw manier in te vullen. Ook bieden we je aantrekkelijke arbeidsvoorwaarden, een unieke werkomgeving en bevlogen collega’s, die betrokken zijn bij hun werk en bij elkaar. Met duizend-en-één expertises in huis kun je hier verrassend veel kanten op. En wát je ook doet, als Wetterskipper maak je altijd een verschil in de wereld om je heen. Je draagt bij aan een veilige en leefbare provincie. Voor mens en natuur. Voor huidige en volgende generaties. En wat doe jij morgen met water?

Waar kom je te werken?

De ontwikkelingen op het gebied van data science gaan razendsnel. Wetterskip Fryslân zet hierop in en daarom zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren data scientist. Help jij mee om de volgende stap te zetten in het datagedreven werken?

Je komt te werken in ons datalab, waar data scientists, analytics translators en de product owner nauw samenwerken om datagestuurde oplossingen te creëren. Binnen een dynamische omgeving draag je bij aan impactvolle innovaties door complexe data-uitdagingen om te zetten in praktische toepassingen. Vanuit het datalab werk je voor diverse opdrachtgevers in onze organisatie. Daarbij werk je aan opdrachten variërend van waterkwaliteit en -kwantiteit tot financiën, onderhoud en duurzaamheid. Binnen dit brede werkveld heb je een belangrijke rol in het ontwikkelen van slimme datatoepassingen die bijdragen aan klimaatneutraal en circulair waterbeheer. Bovendien werk je nauw samen met data scientists van andere waterschappen, met als doel kennisdeling en het versterken van samenwerking.

Wat ga jij doen?

Jij...


gaat aan de slag bij verschillende opdrachtgevers, waarbij je telkens voor een nieuwe uitdaging staat.
gebruikt actuele statistische en wiskundige methoden, gecombineerd met geavanceerde AI-technieken zoals machine learning en deep learning, om complexe datasets te analyseren.
stopt niet bij het ontwikkelen van een succesvol AI-model, maar denkt ook na over hoe je modellen robuust opzet en implementeert, samen met data engineers. Je werkt aan schaalbare en onderhoudbare oplossingen die aansluiten bij de operationele behoeften.
werkt samen met data scientisten, data engineers, data analytics translators en stakeholders van zowel je eigen waterschap als andere waterschappen.
adviseert het team over het toepassen van slimme technologieën binnen de huidige werkprocessen die daarvoor geschikt zijn.


Wie ben jij?

Jij…


beschikt over een relevante hbo/wo opleiding in de richting van bijvoorbeeld data science, business intelligence of vergelijkbaar.
hebt meerdere jaren ervaring en brede kennis van het vakgebied, zoals Python, R en GIS.
bent bedreven in het bouwen en trainen van machine learning en deep learning algoritmes.
hebt gedegen kennis van watervraagstukken vanuit je werk of opleiding, denk hierbij aan: dijkbeheer, waterkwantiteit en -kwaliteit, klimaat- en duurzaamheidsvraagstukken.
hebt ervaring met het werken in de cloud, bij voorkeur met Microsoft Azure.
bent een teamspeler, communicatief vaardig en hebt oog voor kwaliteit in je werkzaamheden.
bent intrinsiek gemotiveerd om je vaardigheden in te zetten voor onderwerpen die maatschappelijk relevant zijn.
blijft voortdurend op de hoogte van veranderende technologische ontwikkelingen en past deze toe in je werk.


Als Wetterskipper krijg je


vertrouwen, verantwoordelijkheid en de ruimte om je werk op jouw manier in te vullen.
verrassend veel loopbaankansen in een organisatie met duizend-en-één expertises.
een unieke werkomgeving en bevlogen collega’s, die betrokken zijn bij hun werk én bij elkaar.


Wat bieden we jou?


een bruto maandsalaris van minimaal € 4.385 ,- en maximaal € 6.058,- (schaal 11 cao werken voor waterschappen, bij een volledige werkweek van 36 uur), afhankelijk van opleiding en ervaring.
een dienstverband van een jaar. Bij goed functioneren is het mogelijk dat na dat eerste jaar een contract voor onbepaalde tijd volgt.
een individueel keuzebudget (IKB). Het IKB bedraagt 21 procent van het brutosalaris en kun je laten uitbetalen of er extra verlof voor kopen.
een eigen opleidingsbudget van minimaal € 6.000,-. Dit budget is voor een periode van vijf jaar. Persoonlijke ambitie en ontwikkeling vinden wij namelijk erg belangrijk.
uitstekende mogelijkheden voor een goede balans tussen werk en privé. Naast variabele werktijden kun je ook thuiswerken. We faciliteren dit met een thuiswerkbudget van € 850,- waarmee je thuis je werkplek arboproof kunt inrichten. Om op elke plek je werk goed te kunnen doen krijg je een laptop en een telefoon.
een reiskostenvergoeding woon-werk van € 0,23 per kilometer wanneer je op je standplaats werkt of een thuiswerkvergoeding van € 3,- per dag wanneer je thuiswerkt.
een pensioen bij het ABP. Daarnaast kun je met korting een aanvullende zorgverzekering of een arbeidsongeschiktheidsverzekering afsluiten.


Is dit jouw volgende baan?

Dan horen we graag van jou! Je kunt uiterlijk tot en met maandag 3 februari 2025 solliciteren.

De sollicitatiegesprekken houden we op woensdagochtend 12 februari 2025.

Als je bij ons komt werken, moet je een verklaring omtrent gedrag inleveren.

Wil je meer weten?

Voor verdere informatie over de functie kun je terecht bij:

Marianne de Vries vakgroepleider flexpool

06 193 542 16

mdevries3@wetterskipfryslan.nl

Voor informatie over sollicitatieprocedure en de rechtspositie kun je terecht bij :

Pieter Siderius HR adviseur werving en selectie

06 431 618 76

psiderius@wetterskipfryslan.nl

Online solliciteren?

Heb je interesse in deze vacature? Stuur dan een e-mail met cv en motivatie naar: sollicitaties.088597@sollicitaties.werkeninfriesland.nl

We lezen graag wat jouw motivatie is om op deze vacature te reageren.

Sollicitaties moeten uiterlijk 03-02-2025 binnen zijn.

Solliciteer

  • een eigen opleidingsbudget van minimaal € 6.000,-. Dit budget is voor een periode van vijf jaar. Persoonlijke ambitie en ontwikkeling vinden wij namelijk erg belangrijk.
  • uitstekende mogelijkheden voor een goede balans tussen werk en privé. Naast variabele werktijden kun je ook thuiswerken. We faciliteren dit met een thuiswerkbudget van € 850,- waarmee je thuis je werkplek arboproof kunt inrichten. Om op elke plek je werk goed te kunnen doen krijg je een laptop en een telefoon.
  • een reiskostenvergoeding woon-werk van € 0,23 per kilometer wanneer je op je standplaats werkt of een thuiswerkvergoeding van € 3,- per dag wanneer je thuiswerkt.
  • een pensioen bij het ABP. Daarnaast kun je met korting een aanvullende zorgverzekering of een arbeidsongeschiktheidsverzekering afsluiten.

Is dit jouw volgende baan?

Dan horen we graag van jou! Je kunt uiterlijk tot en met maandag 3 februari 2025 solliciteren.

De sollicitatiegesprekken houden we op woensdagochtend 12 februari 2025.

Als je bij ons komt werken, moet je een verklaring omtrent gedrag inleveren.

Wil je meer weten?

Voor verdere informatie over de functie kun je terecht bij:

Marianne de Vries vakgroepleider flexpool

06 193 542 16

mdevries3@wetterskipfryslan.nl

Voor informatie over sollicitatieprocedure en de rechtspositie kun je terecht bij :

Pieter Siderius HR adviseur werving en selectie

06 431 618 76

psiderius@wetterskipfryslan.nl

Online solliciteren?

Heb je interesse in deze vacature? Stuur dan een e-mail met cv en motivatie naar: sollicitaties.088597@sollicitaties.werkeninfriesland.nl

We lezen graag wat jouw motivatie is om op deze vacature te reageren.

Sollicitaties moeten uiterlijk 03-02-2025 binnen zijn.

Solliciteer

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Coders Connect is partnering with a cutting-edge start-up that is revolutionizing how businesses leverage data for decision-making. The company focuses on building advanced forecasting solutions that help drive sustainability efforts and optimize resource use. They're looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join their team and be part of creating their first commercial MVP.




What you'll do:

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a critical role in developing data-driven insights and helping shape the company's long-term success. Your responsibilities will include:

Building the First Product: Collaborate in a cross-functional team to design, optimize, and deploy both the forecasting algorithms and data visuals that will power the company's first MVP.
Designing a Future-Proof Infrastructure: Implement explainable ML and AI solutions, develop systems for monitoring model and data drift, and create processes that will allow the rapid production of new models.
Ensuring Platform Performance: Develop product analytics to monitor performance and inform product development decisions.
Staying Ahead with Technology: Keep up with the latest industry trends to ensure the use of cutting-edge technology that maximizes business impact.




Requirements:

Strong Forecasting Background: Extensive experience in building and deploying forecasting models, with hands-on knowledge of various tools and techniques.
Advanced ML Skills: Proficient in deploying machine learning pipelines and creating explainable AI solutions, while staying in tune with business needs.
Data Visualization Expertise: Skilled at translating complex datasets and time series into easy-to-understand insights.
Team-Oriented with a Product Focus: A clear communicator and collaborative team player with a product-led approach to engineering.
Start-up Experience: A background in early-stage environments, demonstrating adaptability and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced setting.
Relocation Flexibility: Must be an EU citizen and available to relocate to the Netherlands.




Preferred Tech Stack:

You will have input on shaping the company’s tech stack. Some preferred tools and technologies include:




Languages: Python for ML, R for data analysis
ML Libraries: scikit-learn, Prophet, TensorFlow, Keras
Data Processing/Storage: SQL, Spark
Cloud Platform: Azure
Version Control: Git




Benefits:

An initial one-year contract with the possibility of extension, based on the success of the collaboration.
A flexible hybrid work environment that promotes work-life balance.
Continuous learning opportunities and room for career growth within a fast-evolving company.
The chance to work with an international team of talented professionals across tech and product.
A meaningful opportunity to contribute to sustainability efforts and make a real-world impact.




Kindly note that VISA Sponsorship is not available for this position.
