The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We’re seeking a Data Scientist with AI-experience. If you thrive on leveraging the power of data and technology to enhance strategic growth, this role is for you! Apply and join us on this exciting journey and play a crucial role in shaping the future of our data and insights area.

My name is Åsa Boffardi, Head of Analytics, Martech & AI within Telia SE B2B. Our mission is to leverage cutting-edge digital technologies and advanced analytics to empower informed decision-making and world class user experiences. We strive to drive innovation and deliver actionable insights, ensuring our organization remains at the forefront of the analytics, Martech and AI, committed to excellence and data-driven success.

Is this your next opportunity?

As a Data Scientist at Telia, you will be responsible for using various statistical techniques and tools to analyze data and identify patterns that can provide insights to drive decision-making. This includes predictive analysis and model building. You will make complex data understandable for stakeholders through visualizations or other means.

The work duties consist of but are not limited to:


Gather and clean data from various sources, including databases, APIs, and websites, ensuring its accuracy and reliability.
Use statistical techniques and tools to analyze data and identify patterns that can provide insights to drive decision-making.
Develop models and evaluate the accuracy, performance, and robustness of machine learning models, ensuring they are reliable and effective in generating insights and predictions.
Work closely with engineers to ensure that machine learning models get into production environments, integrating them into business processes or applications to generate real-time insights and predictions.
Handle tools and processes for monitoring model performance and improving them
Collaborate within an analytical team that works closely with B2B business stakeholders.
Engage in the entire analytical process, from identifying business opportunities to developing and deploying models, and making data-driven decisions


Is this You?

We think that you have a passion for data science and a strong background in statistical techniques and machine learning. You thrive in a collaborative environment and have experience working with various stakeholders to drive business decisions. You bring a strong analytical mindset and have previously worked on developing and deploying machine learning models.

Your experience:


Experience in working as Data Scientist or similar analytics role
Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Finance or equivalent
Strong analytical skills and the ability to comprehend, analyze and put numbers into insights
Strong communication skills with ability to customize messages to reach different competences
Ability to work with large amounts of complex data from multiple data sources.
Skills in SQL and Python are needed, skills in SAS and Qlik and Python is a plus
Experience working on cloud-based platforms


Telia is More Than a Workplace

With us, you will learn from skilled colleagues across international borders, joining a team that makes each other stronger and the world better by solving challenges. We are proud of our friendly atmosphere where people are excited about their work. We thrive on our diversity and ambition to deliver great products and extraordinary experiences for our customers. In a world where choices are endless, if you want to make a real impact, this is a place where you belong.

Apply to join us!

If you fancy joining our team, don’t hesitate to apply!

If you want to know more about the job you are welcome to contact Talent Partner Christine Wilén at christine.wilen@teliacompany.com. Location for this position is: Solna, Stockholm.

We look forward to receiving your application and to making sure that your personal data is kept safely, we kindly ask you to apply through our recruitment system. We are not able to handle resumes via e-mail or equivalent. During the process, required background controls will be performed.

Welcome to Telia – Join us and make better happen!


Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Overview

Metrea is a defense company dedicated to translating commercial innovation into solutions for the hardest problems in national security. With deep mission expertise, Metrea focuses on delivering effects as-a-service across a spectrum of domains including Air & Space, Electromagnetic & Cyber, and Synthetic. Metrea Management provides central services to eleven (11) global capability units via Operations, Solutions, Strategy, Legal, and Finance teams

Capability Unit Overview

Metrea Simulations (MSIM), redefines the cutting edge of flight simulation and services. Our expertise in physics, engineering and artistry allows us to leverage modern technologies in new and unprecedented ways in order to create the most realistic and immersive flight simulation training products and experiences possible. Through our technologies, customers enjoy an optimal path to efficient training, design, technology development and tactical analysis across the aviation sector. Our technology nucleus of advanced AI, flight and sensor modeling enables us to augment reality through the lens of next-generation products and services.

Position Summary

Metrea Simulations is looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join our team focused on creating our simulated world. The role will focus on combining and leveraging geospatial/GIS data and machine learning to create datasets that will help in making our world as accurate, immersive and detailed as we can. You will work with challenging problems that will require you to work creatively all the way from making the best use of our data and identifying new data sources to developing ML models and tuning them. You will work in a small agile team closely with data engineers and developers on the simulation engine side.

This role will require you to be a team player who enjoys working in a multidisciplinary environment and expects you to be communicative and independent in your work. You should be motivated to find creative and scalable solutions for complex problems.

Role And Responsibilities


Develop state-of-the-art machine learning models for applications such as clustering, segmentation and super resolution based on a wide range of geospatial data
Develop quick proof of concepts for new ideas as well as writing code for production pipelines
Handling and transforming geographic/GIS data at scale


Skills And Experience


Advanced Python programming skills
More than 2 years of experience working with Deep Learning (preferably computer vision)
Experience of Tensorflow and/or PyTorch


Additional Eligibility Qualifications


Worked with, or have an interest in, geographic/GIS data, for example satellite imagery
Experience in C++
Experience with Docker
Experience working in a cloud environment (AWS or other)


Our Culture

Metrea’s single core value, “rooted in humility,” is supported by four key attributes: entrepreneurial, systematic, discerning, and over-deliver. These attributes, combined, form our Teammate Firmware, our culture. We explore these attributes during the hiring process when we grow our teams and continually support the growth of our culture. We are a hyper-collaborative, dynamically hierarchical organization united by a passion for what we do, how we do it, who we do it with, and who we do it for.

Right to Work

The employee will have the legal right to work in Sweden and will be able to produce right to work documentation.

Equal Opportunities Statement

Metrea Management Limited (MAM) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or other characteristics protected by law.

Position Type and Expected Hours of Work

This is a full-time (40hrs/week) position.

Work Location

Stockholm – Hybrid remote

Work Environment This job operates in an office setting

Travel

The role will require occasional travels

Title: Trainee Data Scientist Sundbyberg
Description:
Som trainee hos oss är du med och bygger it-infrastruktur som är en del av grunden för ett fungerande samhälle. Vi söker dig som är nyexaminerad och vill utvecklas tillsammans med oss. Vi skapar möjligheter och förutsättningar – resten är upp till dig. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!

Om jobbet

Som trainee inom systemutveckling ingår du i ett av våra agila utvecklingsteam från dag ett. I nära samverkan med verksamheten levererar teamen färdiga lösningar som förenklar för miljontals privatpersoner och företag. Våra system bidrar till ett väl fungerande samhälle genom att skapa förutsättningar för bland annat beskattning, folkbokföring, demokratiska val, brottsbekämpning och internationella samarbeten.

Skatteverkets it-traineeprogram är inne på sitt fjärde år och vi planerar nu för nästa start där vi vill

anställa upp emot 25 traineer på sju olika orter. Under programmet får du kunskap om Skatteverkets verksamhet och bygger på din erfarenhet. Du har en individuell utvecklingsplan som följs upp och revideras under programperioden så att du kan skapa det bästa upplägget utifrån dina förutsättningar och verksamhetens behov. Du har en erfaren mentor som stöd och bollplank. Traineeprogrammet pågår 12 månader och din vardag består av praktik, utbildning, temadagar och workshops, parallellt med att du jobbar i teamet. Programmets upplägg är noga framtaget för att du ska ha den bästa starten på din karriär. Självklart inleds programmet med en kick-off.

Som Data Scientist arbetar du i ett agilt team och utvecklar lösningar som använder avancerad dataanalys och maskininlärning för att skapa nytta för medborgare och företag. Du bidrar till Skatteverkets digitala utveckling och effektivisering av befintlig verksamhet. Du utför avancerade analyser av strukturerad och ostrukturerad data med bland annat statistiska modeller och nätverksanalyser, och arbetar nära verksamheten för att förstå behov och krav på de lösningar som teamet utvecklar. Du tränar, utvärderar och applicerar modeller för bild- och textanalys (NLP) och inom området urval och riskvärdering. Exempel på tillämpningar inkluderar användning av maskininlärning för klassificering av inkommande e-post, handskriftstolkning och identifiering av fel och fusk inom beskattning och folkbokföring.

Teamet består av kompetenser från verksamhet, IT och data science.

Som trainee får du använda din problemlösningsförmåga till att skapa system som underlättar vardagen för många. På vår stora it-avdelning med nära 1500 kollegor har du möjlighet att utvecklas samtidigt som du bidrar till samhällsnyttan. Du har flexibel arbetstid och det är en självklarhet för oss att du ska ha en balans mellan arbete och fritid.

Du tillhör Data- och analyssektion 1 på enhet Gemensamma Tjänster på it-avdelningen, med placering i Sundbyberg. På vår sektion är vi 22 kollegor.

Om dig

För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.

I det här jobbet ska du:


vara en teamspelare och se till både gruppens och din egen prestation
kunna analysera informationsflöden, se samband, mönster och göra avgränsningar
ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker och att kunna tänka om när det behövs
vara nyfiken, gilla utmaningar och ha förmågan att driva din egen och verksamhetens utveckling framåt
uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska och kommunicera på ett engagerande sätt.



Du ska även ha:


en pågående eller nyligen avslutad utbildning inom statistik, civilingenjör, livsvetenskap eller tillämpad matematik/fysik (minst 180 hp) från högskola eller universitet med examen från år 2023 eller framåt, dock senast augusti 2025
erfarenhet av dataanalys och modellutveckling i programmeringsspråket Python från studietiden.



Bra att veta

Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.

En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.

På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.

När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.

Välkommen med din ansökan!

Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.

Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 2 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/538 | Kontakt: Thomas Carlbring, sektionschef thomas.carlbring@skatteverket.se, Jesper Österberg, hr-specialist jesper.osterberg@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2024-12-16 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-01-31
Show more
HTML:
Som trainee hos oss är du med och bygger it-infrastruktur som är en del av grunden för ett fungerande samhälle. Vi söker dig som är nyexaminerad och vill utvecklas tillsammans med oss. Vi skapar möjligheter och förutsättningar – resten är upp till dig. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!

Om jobbet

Som trainee inom systemutveckling ingår du i ett av våra agila utvecklingsteam från dag ett. I nära samverkan med verksamheten levererar teamen färdiga lösningar som förenklar för miljontals privatpersoner och företag. Våra system bidrar till ett väl fungerande samhälle genom att skapa förutsättningar för bland annat beskattning, folkbokföring, demokratiska val, brottsbekämpning och internationella samarbeten.

Skatteverkets it-traineeprogram är inne på sitt fjärde år och vi planerar nu för nästa start där vi vill

anställa upp emot 25 traineer på sju olika orter. Under programmet får du kunskap om Skatteverkets verksamhet och bygger på din erfarenhet. Du har en individuell utvecklingsplan som följs upp och revideras under programperioden så att du kan skapa det bästa upplägget utifrån dina förutsättningar och verksamhetens behov. Du har en erfaren mentor som stöd och bollplank. Traineeprogrammet pågår 12 månader och din vardag består av praktik, utbildning, temadagar och workshops, parallellt med att du jobbar i teamet. Programmets upplägg är noga framtaget för att du ska ha den bästa starten på din karriär. Självklart inleds programmet med en kick-off.

På vår stora it-avdelning med nära 1500 kollegor har du möjlighet att utvecklas samtidigt som du bidrar till samhällsnyttan. Du har flexibel arbetstid och det är en självklarhet för oss att du ska ha en balans mellan arbete och fritid.

Du tillhör Data- och analyssektion 1 på enhet Gemensamma Tjänster på it-avdelningen, med placering i Sundbyberg. På vår sektion är vi 22 kollegor.

Title: Junior Data Scientist/Analytiker (Kort tillsättningstid)
Description:
Vi söker nu en Data Scientist/Analytiker till ett spännande uppdrag inom offentlig sektor!

Arbetsuppgifter


Arbete med kodning och dataframställning i Power BI DAX och SQL
Att skapa intuitiva och tydliga visualisering i Power BI som besvarar beställarens frågor
Att samla in, tolka och skapa verktyg genom dialog med olika intressenter av data i verksamheten
Att välja lämpliga statistiska eller ML-algoritmer för de byggda modellerna
Kodning i Python kan förekomma i vissa projekt
Kunna redogöra för begränsningar och val som gjorts i de datamodeller som skapas
Att noggrant dokumentera det arbete som gjorts


Arbete sker typiskt sett i små grupper om 2 - 3 personer som driver ett visst utvecklingsprojekt.

Kompetens Och Erfarenhet Som Eftersöks


Masterexamen från högskola/universitet (120 hp) inom data- och systemvetenskap. Alternativt en masterexamen (120 hp) inom matematik, elkraft eller energi med minst 30 hp inom data och programmering.
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av SQL
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av Power BI
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom projekt med dataanalys och datavisualisering
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att planera, leda och samordna framtagning av krav på system eller data för systemutveckling.
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet med versionshantering
Flytande i svenska & engelska tal/skrift


OBS: Kort tillsättningstid - intervjuer sker löpande!

Förmåner och utvecklingsmöjligheter hos Liminity


Spännande projekt med ledande branschkunder.
Senaste tekniken och moderna arbetsmetoder.
Omfattande utbildningsmöjligheter och certifieringar.
Konkurrenskraftig lön och attraktiva förmåner.
Mer information finns på https://handbok.liminity.se

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you passionate about information hidden in data, programming, and finance?In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
Leverage your analytical skills to identify and predict customer needs, driving proactive sales and personalized communication towards the corporate segment in Swedbank’s Swedish business.
Utilize your programming and statistical skills to develop models that drive business growth in retail banking.
Work in an analytical team close to operations and be a part of the full analytical process, from identifying business opportunities to developing and deploying models, as well as creating data driven initiatives.
Perform detailed analyses on large datasets and provide management with actionable, data-driven insights that support strategic decision-making.
Understand how operational processes and policies impact key performance indicators (KPIs) across various business disciplines.
Collaborate with colleagues to demonstrate how process changes can lead to improved outcomes.
What is needed in this role:
A creative and problem-solving mindset as well as an ambition to make a difference.
A fundamental understanding of areas in data science (statistics and machine learning)
An interest in corporate retail banking and how a corporate customer’s needs and challenges change throughout life stages
An understanding of the product portfolio within a retail bank.
Excellent communication skill to be able to convey ideas and analytical results effectively verbally and in writing to a non-technical audience.
University degree in a technical field such as statistics, mathematics, economics, or engineering
Experience working with practical applications of statistical modelling/machine learning.
Experience programming within an analytical framework (e.g. R / Python / SAS) and experience using SQL or spark.



What we offer when you join us:
An open, simple and caring culture
Opportunity to create the best experience for our customers
An international, sustainable and inclusive work environment
Development opportunities and advancement in your career
Flexible working options
Access to Group performance program, company pension plan, optional health insurance, and other benefits
"Join our team and...

be a part of an international team of professionals, who are jointly delivering challenging projects, maximizing customer value and increasing Swedbank’s competitive advantage”. Rikard Eriksson, your future manager


We look forward to receiving your application by 15.02.2025. 

Location: Sundbyberg


Recruiting manager: Rikard Eriksson


Wemay begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome yourapplication as soon as possible.


We have made our choice regardingrecruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers orsellers of other recruitment services.

Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.

Title: ML Research Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to bring the next generation of character animation tools to game developers worldwide—while working in a fast-moving startup at the forefront of Generative AI?




This is your opportunity.




At Motorica, we believe that words articulate thought, but motion expresses the soul. We are a cutting-edge startup operating at the intersection of Generative AI and entertainment, where creativity and deep-tech collide.




About Motorica

Our platform—recognized as a research and product leader in the emerging motion modality (one of the six fundamental generative AI modalities alongside image, video, audio, text, and geometry)—enables game studios to create dynamic, lifelike animation faster and more affordably than ever before.




Our foundational model provides AAA quality animations used by some of the biggest names in gaming.
We are currently onboarding multiple AAA+ game studios, that are currently building games with world-renowned IP, to use Motorica within their top titles.




We’re a small, fast-moving team, so you can make a real difference from day one.




What You’ll Do as a ML Research Engineer

Immerse yourself in an academic-led environment where you’ll pioneer ML / Generative AI research within the motion field.
Drive innovations to production, ensuring that creative people love to use the AI you help build.
Collaborate with world-leading experts in generative modeling, breathing life into characters for gaming, entertainment, and beyond.
Contribute to proprietary, state-of-the-art models, pushing the boundaries of what motion-generation technology can do.




What We’re Looking For

Solid foundation in deep learning and probabilistic machine learning
Excellent ability to implement innovations from machine-learning research papers, especially in deep generative modeling
Strong software development skills (Python, PyTorch)
Good command of spoken English and decent written English skills




Meritorious Skills/Experience

Experience implementing diffusion models (or flow matching, rectified flows, or consistency models)
3D animation and/or motion capture data expertise
Published papers at conferences like SIGGRAPH or CVPR, or outstanding contributions to relevant open-source projects
Other notable experience in deep generative modeling

Potentially Useful Skills/Experience

Signal-processing knowledge




Personal Traits

Intellectual curiosity – always questioning and exploring
Strong team communication skills
Hacker mentality – eager to get things working, but never sloppy
Analytical and critical thinker – challenge us to think differently!




Why You’ll Be Excited to Work Here

We are world leaders in what we do, with a core focus on generative machine learning.
We solve real problems—building AI that creative people in the gaming and entertainment industries love to use.
You’ll work with a small and nimble team, which means fast decision-making and a chance to have a real impact.
You’ll push the cutting edge with proprietary, state-of-the-art models that provide AAA quality animations.
We’ve recently signed with top AAA studios, so your work will be part of globally recognized IP.




Compensation and Benefits

Retirement Plan
Insurance Package
Health Benefits (5000 SEK/year)
Options
6 weeks vacation




Are you ready to take the leap, tackle real-world problems, and help shape how the world animates characters in games and beyond? Join Motorica, and let’s build the future of motion together.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
About the job:




This client is currently exploring new ways in which data and AI can be used across the financial space. They are currently looking for an experience engineering within the AI / ML space to join and help push this project forward.




Requirements:

3+ years working as an working in data (ML, Data Engineer, Data Scientist)
Experience with ML frameworks; TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, scikit-learn
Cloud Experience (AWS/Azure/ GCP)
Experience in Software development; Python, R, Java, or C++.
Knowledge of deep learning, NLP, reinforcement learning, or computer vision techniques is highly desirable.







We offer:




This is an exciting opportunity to join a well know organisation in the financial space who is revolutionising how data and AI is used on a daily basis. They are a progressive company that can offer hybrid position in central Stockholm.




Benefits Offered:

30 days holiday
ITP1 Pension
Education allowance
Wellness allowance




Unfortunately this opportunity cannot offer any form of VISA sponsorship and you need to speak Swedish.




If this role could be of interest to you feel free to get in touch




tim.stokes@parallelconsulting.com

+46 85 502 486 58

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Do you want to design cutting-edge AI and ML solutions, work with advanced data models, and empower businesses with innovative analytics?

Nexer Insight is looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our team in Stockholm, Malmö, or Gothenburg. We invite you to embark on an exciting journey where you'll work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits. At Nexer Insight, we are committed to leveraging advanced analytics, machine learning, and AI to drive innovation and deliver impactful solutions for our clients.

Nexer Insight

Nexer Insight is a company that embodies entrepreneurship and innovation. As a Data Scientist with us, you'll work with cutting-edge technologies, including LLMs (Large Language Models), RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), and advanced AI solutions. We value teamwork, professional growth, and a vibrant community spirit. With us, you'll have the opportunity to work on exciting projects, collaborate with experts in the field, and make a meaningful impact in the intersection of data science and AI.

Key Responsibilities


Develop advanced AI/ML models and design solutions leveraging LLMs for various AI use cases, including RAG and intelligent agents.
Apply machine learning, statistical methods, and predictive modeling to solve real-world problems.
Build and deploy data pipelines and cloud-based architectures for ML workloads and MLOps.
Innovate and collaborate with clients to discover new business opportunities and develop tailored solutions.
Work with NLP, computer vision, and containerized applications to deliver high-impact projects.
Leverage platforms like Azure Databricks, Azure Data Lake, and Azure ML for scalable and efficient workflows.
Promote best practices for data science, from architecture and data quality to reliability and performance.



Who You Are

We expect you to have:


Minimum 4 years within Data Science
Strong understanding of LLMs and experience building solutions on top of them for AI-driven solutions.
Experience with RAG and AI-driven agents.
An analytical mindset and strong business acumen.
Problem-solving aptitude and a proactive mindset.
Hands-on experience with applied ML, statistics, and cloud architectures for MLOps.
Proficiency in Python, PySpark, and familiarity with tools like Databricks.
Knowledge of computer vision, NLP, SQL, and containerized apps.
Experience with Azure cloud services such as Azure ML and Azure Data Lake.
Fluency in Swedish and English.



Why Nexer Insight?

At Nexer Insight, we invest in our employees by providing professional development, certifications, and a vibrant working culture. With us, you'll be part of a team pushing boundaries and using advanced data science to create meaningful solutions for leading clients.

Are you ready to take the next step in your career and explore the forefront of AI and data science? Apply today and join us on this exciting journey!
Show more

Title: AI Engineer Large Language Models
Description:
Artificial intelligence is transforming society. AI Sweden is the national centre for applied artificial intelligence, jointly funded by the Swedish government and our partners, both public and private. Our mission is to accelerate the use of AI for the benefit of our society, our competitiveness, and for everyone living in Sweden.

We are now looking for an AI Engineer to further strengthen our NLU Team.

About The Position

AI Sweden is now looking for an AI Engineer to further strengthen our Natural Language Understanding research group. In this role, you will be part of the development of the next generation of Large Language Models in one for more of our EU projects.

We believe that as a person you’re


curious and eager to learn and try out new tools, platforms, and technologies.
someone who makes things happen and constantly looks for ways to take the next step.
comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and not afraid to take your own initiatives.
good at paying attention to detail as well as seeing the broader picture.


And workwise, you’re


a strong programmer with focus on Python and PyTorch.
experienced with large-scale data storage and processing.
experienced with deployment and serving of ML models.
familiar with model quantization and optimization.
familiar with inference frameworks such as ONNX, TensorRT, Triton, etc.
comfortable with various types of hardware platforms including GPU, CPU, and others.
commited to open-source principles.
experience from EU projects is a plus.


To us, artificial intelligence is not only about tech, it’s a force for positive societal change. To work here, you don’t need to know “everything” about AI, but you need to believe in its potential to help shape our society for the better. Some of our colleagues are leading AI experts, but far from all of us are as technically well versed. You'll be working alongside journalists, linguists, policy professionals, leading AI-scientists, historians, entrepreneurs, change leaders, and many more.

Why work for AI Sweden?

To us, artificial intelligence is not only about tech, it’s a force for positive societal change. You'll be working alongside leading AI experts, scientists, journalists, linguists, policy professionals, entrepreneurs, change leaders, and many more. To work here, you don’t need to know “everything” about AI, but you need to believe in its potential to help shape our society for the better.

As an organization, we’re uniquely positioned at the sweet spot of governmental influence and startup agility. Small enough to stay adaptive and have fun but backed by and in close contact with both the government, academia and private and public sector.

Join us to make a real-world impact by contributing to initiatives that benefit society and tackle critical challenges. Be at the forefront of AI innovation, working with cutting-edge technologies and playing a key role in shaping the future of AI in Sweden.

And, within our mission, we can most certainly be a platform empowering you to realize your ideas. AI Sweden’s ability to empower partners and individual team members to do exceedingly well in their profession is a key success factor for driving positive and significant impact.

In short, we like to believe we offer our team members a place to grow, an environment for personal development.

An equal and fair working environment

We strongly believe in diversity and inclusion and are acutely aware of the skewed gender balance in our industry. We actively strive to put together a diverse team in terms of age, gender and background.

Naturally, we’re under a collective agreement (“kollektivavtal”) and offer everything that comes with it in terms of annual leave, pensions, wellness allowance (“friskvårdsbidrag”), and such.

Application Deadline: we will evaluate candidates continuously.

If you have any questions or thoughts, don’t hesitate to contact Mangnus Sahlgren, Research Manager, NLU.

AI Sweden does not accept unsolicited support and kindly ask not to be contacted by any advertisement agents, recruitment agencies or manning companies.

Title: (Senior) Data Scientist (Analytics), Merchant
Description:
Job Description

About Merchant Group at Wolt

Wolt as a platform focuses on serving three main groups: customers, couriers, and merchants. In a nutshell, the Merchant Group strives to make Wolt an integral part of our Merchant’s daily business. Their core mission is to provide merchants with self-service tools and automation that are useful, efficient, reliable, and delightful to use.

About The Merchant Analytics Team

Merchant Analytics is an embedded analytics function within the Merchant Group. The team works to unlock insights related to the marketplace and turn them into actionable recommendations that drive the success of merchants at Wolt. While keeping merchants at heart, the analytics team focuses on all kinds of analytics projects that can benefit merchants while ensuring a seamless consumer experience and also supporting Wolt’s marketplace strategy.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist at Wolt, your role involves diving into our data to solve crucial business problems. The scope of this role ranges from diagnosing problem areas to identifying solutions to designing experiments and ultimately influencing decision-making. This is a rare, operational, and actionable data-driven experience. When you join this team, you will be driving action from the frontlines, rather than just doing yet another analytics role.

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland, Germany, Sweden and Estonia. You have the chance to decide the ways of working — a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.


Our humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
4-5+ years of experience in an analytics or data science position within an industry or research setting.
Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing, experimentation and causal inference using statistical software packages in Python, R, or equivalent.
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar.
Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach.


Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

🎄Please note that we might have delays due to the festive season.

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!


Show more

Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Visendi is an AI lab specializing in building tailored Digital Coworkers based on Generative AI technologies for industrial applications. Our focus areas include CAD engineering, product management, e-mobility, digital supply chains, and manufacturing optimization. Our approach focuses on researching generative AI technologies in our lab and, in parallel, finding smart ways to apply them in industrial settings. We then help companies build their own customized AI solutions to meet their unique needs. In addition to client work, we apply our research to our in-house R&D projects, where we envision how innovators will approach product development, supply chains, and manufacturing in the future.




We’re looking for an AI engineer who is excited to build applications powered by generative AI. At Visendi, you’ll get hands-on experience with AI, learn from our team, and help shape innovative solutions for the industrial sector.




The Role:

Research, develop, and implement AI solutions, including training and tuning AI models and creating innovative applications of generative AI for industrial environments.
Develop scalable and efficient methods for training, testing and deploying AI models in real-world scenarios.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including software developers and industry experts, to align AI solutions with project goals.
Continuously refine and optimize AI models to improve their practicality and effectiveness in industrial use cases.
Engage directly with clients, including occasional on-site work, to understand requirements and tailor AI solutions to meet their needs.




We’re Looking for Someone Who:

Has experience developing AI models using traditional frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch.
Has experience working with LLMs, including fine-tuning, prompt engineering, and orchestrating agents to tackle more complex challenges.
Has successfully deployed LLM solutions to production environments.
Thrives in a dynamic startup environment, embracing diverse responsibilities and adapting to change.
Is a proactive, hands-on problem-solver who excels in experimental and creative settings.




Your Profile:

You have a solid foundation in LLMs, machine learning, and software development, with a proven track record of developing innovative solutions that address real-world challenges.
Ability to adapt to new challenges and learn quickly in a dynamic environment.

While formal education is appreciated, we care more about your experience building real-world applications and solving problems.




Why Join Visendi?

Work at the forefront of AI innovation in the heavy industry sector.
Learn and grow with hands-on experience in generative AI.
Collaborate with a dynamic team of experts in both AI and industrial fields.
Work on diverse projects, from AI research to client-focused implementations.
Enjoy a flexible work environment that values creativity and professional growth.
Competitive salary, paid vacation, and health benefits.

﻿

Please consider joining if you want to be part of driving a new wave of hardware innovation. Send your resume and a description of why you're a fit for the role to: recruitment@visendi.ai.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Are you a talented Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in algorithm development and implementation using C/C++? We're seeking a skilled professional to join our team on a short-term contract and contribute to cutting-edge projects.




🔧 What You’ll Do:

Develop and optimize ML algorithms.
Implement robust solutions using C/C++.
Collaborate with a dynamic team to deliver high-impact results.

🌟 What You Bring:

Strong experience in machine learning and algorithm development.
Proficiency in C and C++ programming.
Ability to work independently on a short-term basis.




📍 Location: Remote or Hybrid (depending on project needs)

📅 Duration: Short-term Contract




Join us in shaping the future with innovative solutions!




💼 Apply today or reach out for more details.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
B3 Link, som är en del av B3-koncernen, är bland annat unika genom vår expertis inom AI-tillämpningar och förmåga att leverera projekt till våra kunder. Vi kombinerar teknik och affärsbehov, och tar ansvar för hela projektcykeln – från business case till implementering av AI-lösningar.

Om rollen

Nu söker vi dig som har erfarenhet inom maskininlärning! Att vara anställd på B3 Link innebär att du hjälper våra kunder i deras utvecklingsprojekt och dagliga utmaningar. Vi ser gärna att du har vana att arbeta såväl självständigt som kundnära och är van vid ett agilt teambaserat arbetssätt.

Vi letar efter dig som har:


Minst 5 års dokumenterad arbetserfarenhet inom maskininlärning eller liknande område
Erfarenhet av att utveckla och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller
Gedigen erfarenhet inom minst ett programmeringsspråk (te.x. Python, Scala eller R)
Erfarenhet av SQL och databashantering
Erfarenhet av dataanalys- och visualiseringsverktyg så som Pandas, Matplotlib
Kunskap om maskininlärningsbibliotek som TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn
Behärskar god svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


Vad vi erbjuder:

Att vi trivs tillsammans på B3 Link är otroligt viktigt. Anledningen till att många börjar hos oss är bland annat det stora fokuset på kompetensutveckling, där vi kontinuerligt delar kunskap med varandra och uppmuntrar till kompetensutveckling och certifieringar. Vi erbjuder bland annat:


Generös kompetensutveckling
Attraktiv lönemodell
En fantastisk wellness- och medarbetarsatsning


Om B3

B3 Link är en del av B3-koncernen. B3 är en börsnoterad koncern och trygg arbetsgivare med hög medarbetarnöjdhet. B3 har ca 1000 medarbetare inom många olika expertområden. B3 är rankad som Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsplats 2021 av Great Place to Work, utsett till Sveriges IT Karriärföretag 2022 och 2023, samt vann utmärkelsen Årets Karriärföretag 2022. Vi lever efter våra värdeord erfarenhet, olikheter och energi samt satsar på hållbarhet i alla led. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra presterar bättre och har därför B3 Team som anordnar aktiviteter inom wellness, från yoga och löpning till musikquiz och föreläsningar om stresshantering och mental hälsa.

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!

Har du frågor om tjänsten? Tveka inte att kontakta rekryteringsansvarig, Petra, för denna tjänst på petra.magnusson@b3.se
Show more
HTML:
B3 Link, som är en del av B3-koncernen, är bland annat unika genom vår expertis inom AI-tillämpningar och förmåga att leverera projekt till våra kunder. Vi kombinerar teknik och affärsbehov, och tar ansvar för hela projektcykeln – från business case till implementering av AI-lösningar.

Om rollen

Nu söker vi dig som har erfarenhet inom maskininlärning! Att vara anställd på B3 Link innebär att du hjälper våra kunder i deras utvecklingsprojekt och dagliga utmaningar. Vi ser gärna att du har vana att arbeta såväl självständigt som kundnära och är van vid ett agilt teambaserat arbetssätt.

Vi letar efter dig som har:

  • Minst 5 års dokumenterad arbetserfarenhet inom maskininlärning eller liknande område
  • Erfarenhet av att utveckla och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller
  • Gedigen erfarenhet inom minst ett programmeringsspråk (te.x. Python, Scala eller R)
  • Erfarenhet av SQL och databashantering
  • Erfarenhet av dataanalys- och visualiseringsverktyg så som Pandas, Matplotlib
  • Kunskap om maskininlärningsbibliotek som TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn
  • Behärskar god svenska och engelska i tal och skrift

Vad vi erbjuder:

Att vi trivs tillsammans på B3 Link är otroligt viktigt. Anledningen till att många börjar hos oss är bland annat det stora fokuset på kompetensutveckling, där vi kontinuerligt delar kunskap med varandra och uppmuntrar till kompetensutveckling och certifieringar. Vi erbjuder bland annat:

  • Generös kompetensutveckling
  • Attraktiv lönemodell
  • En fantastisk wellness- och medarbetarsatsning

Om B3

B3 Link är en del av B3-koncernen. B3 är en börsnoterad koncern och trygg arbetsgivare med hög medarbetarnöjdhet. B3 har ca 1000 medarbetare inom många olika expertområden. Title: AI Developer
Description:
Do you want to be part of a team that is developing tomorrow's businesses and

organizations? At PwC Sweden, we share a common goal of contributing to something bigger than ourselves by building trust and transparency, making positive change, and creating long-term sustainable value. Together, we create a meaningful and rewarding career for you.

Become a part of PwC’s Internal Firm Services

As an employee within PwC's business support, you play an important role in ensuring that the organization operates smoothly and efficiently and delivers value to our clients and stakeholders. Within business support, there are six units that collaborate to support internal operations. We work with everything from communications, marketing, human resources, and IT to finance, procurement, risk management, and quality assurance. By coordinating and collaborating within these various departments, the organization can leverage our specialized knowledge to support and improve operations on a larger scale.

Are you our new colleague in the fast growing AI team?

Are you passionate about AI and eager to make a tangible impact? We are looking for a data scientist who excels in collaboration and enjoys building strong relationships with colleagues to ideate and develop exciting AI solutions. You are naturally curious and adaptable, finding joy in solving complex problems. You take pride in your personal responsibility and are driven to achieve outstanding results.

We offer opportunities for your continuous professional growth, supported by the

collaborative environment within the work environment you're part of. A strong

inclination to collaboration is essential, as you will often work in diverse environments and support different business units.

Your Main Tasks Would Include


Lead the deployment and continuous maintenance of machine learning models


and AI solutions, ensuring high performance and effectiveness in solving

business challenges.


Assist in the design and development of machine learning models and AI


solutions to address business problems.


Assist in the development and maintenance of product pipelines.
Stay current with the latest advancements and industry trends in AI, and apply


them to improve existing processes.


Participate in training sessions and workshops to enhance skills and knowledge,


fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement.

Qualifications For The Position


Relevant education, preferably in Computer Science, Data Science,


Mathematics, Electronics or a related field.


Proficiency in Python.
Practical understanding of generative AI frameworks (vector databases,


LangChain frameworks, OpenAI frameworks,etc).


Experience working with technical requirements, development, testing, etc.
Experience implementing machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g.,


scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).


Excellent communication, presentation and collaboration skills.
Ability to work effectively and adapt to diverse and dynamic environments.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in both spoken and written English.
Collaborate with the global PwC network to identify opportunities for AI


innovations and drive the implementation of new technologies and

methodologies to PwC Sweden.

,

Recruitment Process

We will review applications continuously, and the position may be filled earlier than the application deadline.

Please Attach The Following Documents To Your Application


CV
Cover letter


We believe in having a recruitment process that applies to everyone. As part of the selection, we use psychometric tests to ensure an objective, unbiased, and fair selection. The tests are the first step in our selection process. You will receive a link to these tests after we have received your application.

We value the personal meeting to understand the value you can bring to PwC and what we can offer you. The interview process usually consists of multiple stages and various types of interviews. When meeting with HR, you will have a competency-based interview where we examine the personality test you completed before the interview. During the interview with the business, you will have the opportunity to meet with the relevant team to discuss the role. We call for interviews continuously, and we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

Read more about who we are, and how we are safeguarding inclusion and diversity through our recruiting at www.pwc.se/karriar.

Do you have questions? Let us know!

Questions relating to the job will be answered by Nithin Virinchipuram,

nithin.virinchipuram@pwc.com

If you instead have questions about the recruitment process or your application, reach out to the recruiter: Alexandra Lindskoog, alexandra.lindskoog@pwc.com
Show more

Title: Data Scientist & Startup Founder (March 2025)
Description:
This ad is not for an employment, but an opportunity to build a VC-backed startup from the ground up.




Who you are:

You are a highly skilled technical professional with a proven track record in developing innovative solutions. Your strong programming abilities and experience in building complex algorithms enable you to address critical challenges within the tech industry. You are a proactive individual with a passion for progress, driven to make a significant impact through cutting-edge technological advancements.




The Antler Founder Residency

Join a dynamic cohort of 200+ highly motivated entrepreneurs for an immersive 12-week program. Visit our website for a detailed breakdown of how we'll support your startup launch.

12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off March, 2025, in Stockholm.
Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow Founders to find your co-founder(s).
Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a net cash investment of EUR 100k for 10% equity.
Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success!




Program Details

Start Date: March 3rd, 2025
Location: Onsite at our Stockholm office
Compensation: While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
Visa Sponsorship: Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.




For our March 2025 cohort, we're looking for someone who:

Excel in Data Science, Machine Learning, or AI, with a knack for advancing technology.
Can unearth insights from intricate data, leading in ML methodologies.
Embrace the challenge of merging diverse data for revolutionary models.
Are adept at prototyping innovative solutions that pave the way for real-world applications.
Navigate product development with strategic foresight and precision.
Experienced in the start-up ecosystem
Optional: have an idea that solves a problem you’re passionate about, but you understand the need for co-pilots who share your vision and values




Application Process

Our streamlined application process takes only 2-3 weeks:

Apply through our website.
Participate in an introductory interview.
Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
Receive a potential offer.




Meet Our Nordic Success Stories:

Wingbits: A community-driven flight data tracking platform
Two: A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
Evyon: A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
Glint Solar: Software accelerating identification of optimal solar installation sites.
PerPlant: AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture.

Title: AI Developer for generative code models
Description:
Artificial intelligence is transforming society. AI Sweden is the national center for applied artificial intelligence and our mission is to accelerate the use of AI for the benefit of our society, our competitiveness, and for everyone living in Sweden. We drive impactful initiatives in areas such as healthcare, energy, and the public sector while pushing the boundaries of AI research and innovation in fields such as natural language processing and edge learning. Join us in harnessing the untapped value of AI to drive innovation and create sustainable value for Sweden.

We are now looking for a AI developer for a project on generative code models in our NLU team.

About The Position

AI Sweden is part of a project on developing generative code models for the automotive industry. The project will investigate the intersection between generative code models and formal code verification techniques, and we aim to develop a novel type of verification-driven generative code model.

In the role as an AI developer, you will focus on generative code models based on the Transformer architecture. You will work in Sweden’s leading research group on Large Language Models (the NLU group at AI Sweden), and you will encounter a range of stimulating technical challenges and develop some of the most sought-after technical skills in the industry. You’ll be working in a highly stimulating environment where your creativity and power of initiative is not just welcomed, but essential. This position is perfect for those who want to apply their programming skills and inventiveness to cutting-edge development of Transformer-based code models.

We encourage female applicants, and we aim to fill the position as soon as possible.

We believe that as a person you’re

Inquisitive Learner: Passionate about AI and machine learning, you are driven by a desire to continually learn and stay on top of the latest developments.

Practical Problem Solver: With a talent for innovative solutions, you see past challenges and focus on constructive outcomes. Your approach combines practicality with creativity.

Effective Communicator: Your ability to convey complex ideas clearly is important. We highly value a knowledge-sharing culture within our diverse team.

And workwise, you are

Strong Programmer: You have excellent and proven programming skills in Python and preferably also C and C++.

Practical Deep Learner: You have previous experience working with deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch. HPC experience is a plus.

Experienced Transformer: You have previously worked with Transformer-based models. It’s a plus if you have worked with autoregressive Transformers and code models.

Agile Implementer & Tester: Quick to grasp and understand new machine learning techniques and trends, you'll experiment with cutting-edge techniques alongside our team.

Why work for AI Sweden?

To us, artificial intelligence is not only about tech, it’s a force for positive societal change. You'll be working alongside leading AI experts, scientists, journalists, linguists, policy professionals, entrepreneurs, change leaders, and many more. To work here, you don’t need to know “everything” about AI, but you need to believe in its potential to help shape our society for the better.

As an organization, we’re uniquely positioned at the sweet spot of governmental influence and startup agility. Small enough to stay adaptive and have fun but backed by and in close contact with both the government, academia and private and public sector.

Join us to make a real-world impact by contributing to initiatives that benefit society and tackle critical challenges. Be at the forefront of AI innovation, working with cutting-edge technologies and playing a key role in shaping the future of AI in Sweden.

And, within our mission, we can most certainly be a platform empowering you to realize your ideas. AI Sweden’s ability to empower partners and individual team members to do exceedingly well in their profession is a key success factor for driving positive and significant impact.

In short, we like to believe we offer our team members a place to grow, an environment for personal development.

An equal and fair working environment

We strongly believe in diversity and inclusion and are acutely aware of the skewed gender balance in our industry. We actively strive to put together a diverse team in terms of age, gender and background.

Naturally, we’re under a collective agreement (“kollektivavtal”) and offer everything that comes with it in terms of annual leave, pensions, wellness allowance (“friskvårdsbidrag”), and such.

Application Deadline: we will evaluate candidates continuously.

If you have any questions or thoughts, don’t hesitate to contact Magnus Sahlgren, Research Manager, NLU.

AI Sweden does not accept unsolicited support and kindly ask not to be contacted by any advertisement agents, recruitment agencies or manning companies.
Show more

Title: Senior ML Engineer
Description:
Company Description

We're an award-winning Google Cloud partner. We're the experts in transforming businesses and shaping the future of cloud technology. Join us and collaborate with top minds, build groundbreaking solutions, and make a real difference for our clients. Enjoy extensive professional development, global reach, and a supportive, Google-inspired culture. If you're passionate about the cloud, this is where you want to be.

With over 13 years of experience in Google Cloud under our belt, offices in 18 countries and more than 600 experts, we have deployed practical innovation alongside Google. We focus on infrastructure modernisation, data management, smart analytics, application modernisation, and AI & machine learning.

Curious about our projects? We got you: Check out our success stories


Job Description

Day-to-day life

Design, develop, and deploy cutting-edge machine learning models – crafting bespoke AI solutions for our Nordic clients.
Collaborate with data scientists, data engineers, and Google experts to overcome complex challenges and deliver impactful outcomes.
Champion knowledge sharing and mentorship, guiding junior colleagues in the art of machine learning and fostering a culture of continuous learning.
Stay at the forefront of Google Cloud AI/ML technologies, continuously expanding your expertise and exploring new possibilities.
Confidently present solutions to clients, bridging the gap between complex algorithms and real-world business value, while actively cultivating and expanding those customer relationships.



Want to know more? Check out our people stories on Youtube


Qualifications

We're seeking a passionate and experienced ML Engineer with a proven track record in designing, developing, and deploying machine learning models. You'll be a cloud enthusiast with a deep understanding of AI/ML principles and hands-on experience with cloud technologies. As a coding expert, you'll possess strong Python skills and a solid foundation in machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, LangChain, LangGraph).



Excellent communication is essential – you'll build strong relationships with clients, translate their needs into innovative AI solutions, and present complex topics with clarity and confidence. You're a true collaborator, thriving in team environments where knowledge sharing and mutual support are paramount.

Fluency in both Swedish and English is required.


Additional Information

Why Choose Devoteam G Cloud?

Own the AI revolution: Dive into the exciting world of Generative AI and ML, playing a pivotal role in shaping projects around Google's groundbreaking Gemini foundation model.
Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.
End-to-End Impact: Drive complete business transformations, from strategy to implementation and beyond.
Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.



"Partnering with Devoteam has been a highlight of our efforts at Google Cloud. Their dedication and expertise elevate every project we undertake together. It's truly a collaboration that delivers exceptional results." — Alexander Percivall, Senior Partner Engineer, Google Cloud Nordics, Stockholm, Sweden.

We do plenty of activities, like meet-ups, hackathons, and partnerships. Don’t lose any of them: follow us on LinkedIn

Benefits

Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.
Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.
A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.
An international, diverse, and inclusive team.
A human-centric and value-based company culture.
Wellness grants for sports activities (5,000 SEK/year).
A modern office in central Stockholm.
Full provision of work tools.
A variety of social events.



Our culture is based on continuous learning and career development, supported by a genuine, inclusive, and expert team that really loves pizza.

 

Want to know more about life at Devoteam? Check our Instagram page

Ready to join an elite team? Apply for our Senior ML Engineer position and become part of something exceptional!

Is this not the right position for you? Don’t worry, we have plenty of opportunities! Check out our Career page

 

Show more

Excellent communication is essential – you'll build strong relationships with clients, translate their needs into innovative AI solutions, and present complex topics with clarity and confidence. You're a true collaborator, thriving in team environments where knowledge sharing and mutual support are paramount.

Fluency in both Swedish and English is required.


Additional Information

Why Choose Devoteam G Cloud?
  • Own the AI revolution: Dive into the exciting world of Generative AI and ML, playing a pivotal role in shaping projects around Google's groundbreaking Gemini foundation model.
  • Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
  • Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
  • Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.
  • End-to-End Impact: Drive complete business transformations, from strategy to implementation and beyond.
  • Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.


"Partnering with Devoteam has been a highlight of our efforts at Google Cloud. Their dedication and expertise elevate every project we undertake together. It's truly a collaboration that delivers exceptional results." — Alexander Percivall, Senior Partner Engineer, Google Cloud Nordics, Stockholm, Sweden.

We do plenty of activities, like meet-ups, hackathons, and partnerships. Don’t lose any of them: follow us on LinkedIn

Benefits
  • Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.
  • Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.
  • A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.
  • An international, diverse, and inclusive team.
  • A human-centric and value-based company culture.
  • Wellness grants for sports activities (5,000 SEK/year).
  • A modern office in central Stockholm.
  • Full provision of work tools.
  • A variety of social events.


Our culture is based on continuous learning and career development, supported by a genuine, inclusive, and expert team that really loves pizza.

 

Want to know more about life at Devoteam? Check our Instagram page

Ready to join an elite team? Apply for our Senior ML Engineer position and become part of something exceptional!

Is this not the right position for you? Don’t worry, we have plenty of opportunities! Check out our Career page

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist




Do you want to design cutting-edge AI and ML solutions, work with advanced data models, and empower businesses with innovative analytics?




Nexer Insight is looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our team in Stockholm, Malmö, or Gothenburg. We invite you to embark on an exciting journey where you'll work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits. At Nexer Insight, we are committed to leveraging advanced analytics, machine learning, and AI to drive innovation and deliver impactful solutions for our clients.




Nexer Insight

Nexer Insight is a company that embodies entrepreneurship and innovation. As a Data Scientist with us, you'll work with cutting-edge technologies, including LLMs (Large Language Models), RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), and advanced AI solutions. We value teamwork, professional growth, and a vibrant community spirit. With us, you'll have the opportunity to work on exciting projects, collaborate with experts in the field, and make a meaningful impact in the intersection of data science and AI.




Key Responsibilities

Develop advanced AI/ML models and design solutions leveraging LLMs for various AI use cases, including RAG and intelligent agents.
Apply machine learning, statistical methods, and predictive modeling to solve real-world problems.
Build and deploy data pipelines and cloud-based architectures for ML workloads and MLOps.
Innovate and collaborate with clients to discover new business opportunities and develop tailored solutions.
Work with NLP, computer vision, and containerized applications to deliver high-impact projects.
Leverage platforms like Azure Databricks, Azure Data Lake, and Azure ML for scalable and efficient workflows.
Promote best practices for data science, from architecture and data quality to reliability and performance.




Who You Are

We expect you to have:

Minimum 4 years within Data Science
Strong understanding of LLMs and experience building solutions on top of them for AI-driven solutions.
Experience with RAG and AI-driven agents.
An analytical mindset and strong business acumen.
Problem-solving aptitude and a proactive mindset.
Hands-on experience with applied ML, statistics, and cloud architectures for MLOps.
Proficiency in Python, PySpark, and familiarity with tools like Databricks.
Knowledge of computer vision, NLP, SQL, and containerized apps.
Experience with Azure cloud services such as Azure ML and Azure Data Lake.
Fluency in Swedish and English.







Why Nexer Insight?

At Nexer Insight, we invest in our employees by providing professional development, certifications, and a vibrant working culture. With us, you'll be part of a team pushing boundaries and using advanced data science to create meaningful solutions for leading clients.




Are you ready to take the next step in your career and explore the forefront of AI and data science? Apply today and join us on this exciting journey!

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
About Us

At Leya, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.

You are joining an early stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Bird & Bird, Pérez-Llorca, and Mannheimer Swartling. Backed by over $35M in funding from top investors including Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, and top tier law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.

The role

Are you ready to take your AI career to the next level? At Leya, we’re on a mission to revolutionize the legal industry with cutting-edge AI and LLM tech. We’re seeking an AI Engineer to join our face-moving team, where you’ll work on technically difficult projects with the support of an amazing team, and help redefine how legal professionals work.

What you will be doing:


Architect and implement all AI and LLM features at Leya
Ensure we utilize the latest and greatest LLM features, agentic tools etc
Take ownership of our codebase, balancing high-quality code, security and speed of development
Own and drive forward PoCs and solve broad technical challenges


Who you are


A passionate software engineer with a few years of experience implementing and evaluating AI and LLM applications
A strong coder: Proficient in languages like Python, with an emphasis on clean, efficient, and maintainable code.
You’re autonomous and take pride in the systems you architect
You’re a low ego, true team player
You’re a problem solver who’s not afraid to come up with creative solutions and think holistically about applied AI


What's in it for you


Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


We founded Leya with the vision of giving lawyers the tools they deserve.

We didn't build Leya for how law is practiced today; we built it for how it should be practiced tomorrow.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer (Flexible location)

Are you eager to shape the future of our industry together with us? At Seco Tools, we’re looking for an AI Engineer to join us. We welcome you to a people company in the machining business – characterized by a genuine interest in our customers’ success, an inclusive family spirit and personal commitment.

About The Role

As an AI Engineer, you will play a key role in developing and implementing AI-driven solutions across various business functions. You will collaborate closely with stakeholders from different departments to understand their needs, identify opportunities for AI adoption, and build scalable AI applications. Additionally, you will contribute to enhancing our company’s overall AI capabilities—improving our technology stack, refining processes, and upskilling teams. Location for the role is flexible, preferably close to our premises within Europe or India.

Key Responsibilities


Develop & Implement AI Solutions: Work with business units to design, build, and deploy AI/ML models that drive efficiency, automation, and innovation.
Collaborate with Business Stakeholders: Understand business challenges, identify AI opportunities, and translate them into technical solutions.
Enhance AI Capabilities: Improve our AI ecosystem by advancing technologies, refining workflows, and fostering AI literacy within the organization.
Ensure AI Governance & Scalability: Develop robust AI models that align with ethical, legal, and operational standards.
Implement Software Development Best Practices: Follow software engineering principles, including version control, code reviews, CI/CD pipelines, and automated testing.
Stay Ahead of AI Trends: Continuously research emerging AI technologies and best practices to keep our company at the forefront of AI adoption.


About You

We’re looking for someone with proven Experience in AI Implementation: demonstrated ability to develop and implement AI solutions in a business setting, delivering tangible impact. Hands-on experience with lakehouse solutions, preferably Databricks. Strong understanding of software development best practices, DevOps methodologies, CI/CD pipelines, and MLOps for AI model deployment. Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, NLP, computer vision, or other relevant AI technologies. Experience with cloud platforms, preferably Azure. Ability to understand business needs and align AI solutions with strategic goals. We also believe that you have a passion for finding innovative AI-driven solutions to complex challenges and strong interpersonal skills to work with cross-functional teams and present AI concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Acting in a global environment calls for fluency in both verbal and written English

What We Offer

A dynamic and innovative work environment within a leading organization in the cutting tools industry.Opportunities to shape the strategic direction of a key business segment. A collaborative and supportive team culture. Competitive compensation and benefits package. Join us to lead the evolution of our Round Tools business and make a lasting impact on our industry.

Our Seco culture

Seco employees across the globe share our family spirit, along with a passion for our customers and a personal commitment to ensure success in everything we do. For us, it’s also clear that our diversities form an amazing foundation for achieving great results. Visit our LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us and our products further.

Application

Send your application no later than February,5 2025. Read more about us and apply at secotools.com (Job ID: R0067832).

As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.

Contact Information

For further information about this position please contact a member of our project team Praskovia Sheremeteva, Praskovia.sheremeteva@sandvik.com

At Seco Tools we develop and offer advanced products & solutions that make metal cutting easier. We work together with our customers to identify and implement the best solutions for their needs. The corporate culture empowers employees through shared values: Passion for our customers, Family Spirit, Personal commitment. Seco Tools has a presence in more than 75 countries and employs about 4000 people.
