Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Description

Position at LeoVegas Group

About The Role

We are looking for an enthusiastic mid-level data scientist to join our dynamic and growing team at LeoVegas. The ideal candidate will have an open-minded attitude and be eager to learn. You will get the opportunity to work hands-on in the entire lifecycle of putting machine learning based applications in production.

Our team is responsible for providing the entire organisation, including all brands and markets, with algorithms for decision-making support, product personalization, and optimization and automation of business processes. Our project portfolio is diverse and constantly growing. Examples include churn prediction, lifetime-value prediction, player risk assessment models (responsible gaming), money laundering detection, and recommender systems to name a few.

Our data science team is not focused on reporting; we actively develop and deploy models into production that directly serve and enhance the entire organisation.

YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:


Interpret stakeholder requirements to develop, implement, and fine-tune machine learning models that address their specific needs and business objectives.
Improve and maintain existing machine learning models to enhance their performance, accuracy, and efficiency over time as well as following new regulations.
Collaborate cross-functionally with various teams, including product, engineering, and business, to ensure seamless integration and alignment of machine learning solutions with overall company goals.
Analyse and transform data using SQL to prepare datasets for machine learning model development and ensure data integrity and accuracy.
Conduct A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the effectiveness of new features and promotions.
Collaborate with external parties to enable outsourced ML based applications.
Perform advanced analysis on large and complex datasets to extract actionable insights and inform the business to make informed decisions


OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:

Essential Skills


2+ years of experience in a similar role
Understanding of fundamental concepts in statistics and machine learning
Experience in apply machine learning, either in academia or industry
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R.
Experience with SQL
Basic understanding of Git


NICE TO HAVES


Experience in any of the following techniques or systems: Airflow, Bayesian statistics, BigQuery, causal inference, Docker, GitHub, Google Cloud Platform, Kubeflow, natural language processing, neural networks, scikit-learn, Stan, survival analysis, TensorFlow, time-series forecasting, Vertex AI, and XGBoost


Who We Are

At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices worldwide.

Benefits


Hybrid work policy
4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
30 annual vacation days
Occupational Pension
5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
Parental Leave Top-Up
Possibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
1,500 SEK equipment allowance
Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


JOIN US!

In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!

Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!

**As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please**

_________________________________________________________________________________________________

Title: Data Scientist till Data & Analys
Description:
Var med och driv innovation och frigör kraften i SJs data. Genom traditionell BI, avancerad analys, maskininlärning och AI kan du skapa betydande affärsvärde och forma framtiden för SJ.




Vi söker dig som brinner för att förvandla data till insikter och möjligheter. Hos oss får du chansen att forma framtiden som en del av vår resa mot att bli ännu mer datadrivna. Du kommer att utforska, identifiera och frigöra potentialen i SJs data över hela verksamheten med hjälp av traditionell BI, avancerad analys, maskininlärning och AI. Rollen är en nyckel i att skapa värde och innovation som verkligen gör skillnad – både för SJ och våra kunder.




SJs övergripande mål är att bidra till Skandinaviens tillväxt- och klimatmål genom att leverera 50% mer resor till 2030. För att kunna realisera denna tillväxtresa gör vi historiska investeringar på 19 miljarder i nya snabbtåg, nya regionaltåg och uppgraderingar av vår befintliga fordonsflotta.




Som en viktig del av vår spännande resa satsar vi också på vår förmåga att skapa värde genom användning av data och analys. Enheten Data & Analys etablerades 2023 och ska nu skala upp förmågan för att kunna leverera brett inom koncernen. Förmågan är viktig för att framtidssäkra verksamheten och maximera nyttan från större investeringar, inte bara på fordonssidan, utan även i nya IT-system för bland annat boknings- och säljsystem, personalplanering, operativ trafikledning och intelligent fordonsunderhåll.




Din kommande roll

Som Data Scientist blir du en central del av vårt nybildade team Data & Analys. Här får du möjlighet att utvecklas i en roll där du kommer att:




Driva spännande projekt från idéstadiet till färdig lösning, med direkt påverkan på företagets framgång
Arbeta med hela datahanteringsprocessen, inklusive insamling, förberedelse, modellering och visualisering av data
Implementera innovativa lösningar i produktionsmiljöer och hantera stora datamängder för att upptäcka värdefulla insikter
Kommunicera dina fynd till olika intressenter och hjälpa till att omvandla tekniska insikter till konkreta affärsstrategier
Utforska och experimentera med modern teknik för att förbättra våra processer. Du kommer balansera snabb experimentell utveckling med skapandet av strukturerad och underhållsbar kod för produktion




Enheten Data & Analys är en del av Ekonomifunktionen och arbetar tillsammans med IT-divisionen, samt nära med Strategi & Verksamhetsutveckling och Business Control som båda återfinns inom Ekonomi.




Förväntningar på den vi söker

En akademisk examen inom datavetenskap, statistik, matematik, fysik eller liknande område
Stark programmeringskompetens i Python och SQL
Erfarenhet av molnbaserade miljöer; kunskap om Azure Databricks är ett stort plus
Förståelse för agila arbetsmetoder och moderna utvecklingsprinciper som DevOps och CI/CD
En analytisk och nyfiken natur, med en passion för att lösa komplexa problem
Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och förmåga att göra tekniska koncept begripliga för icke-tekniska intressenter
Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift
Meriterande är erfarenheter av prediktivt underhåll




Ansökan och information

Urval sker löpande så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, dock senast den 23 januari 2025.




I den här rekryteringen samarbetar SJ med Jefferson Wells och Experis. Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta ansvariga rekryteringskonsulter Malin Magnusson, 076-7806864, malin.magnusson@jeffersonwells.se, och Anki Snis, 0703-775969, anki.snis@se.experis.com.

Show more
HTML:
Var med och driv innovation och frigör kraften i SJs data. Genom traditionell BI, avancerad analys, maskininlärning och AI kan du skapa betydande affärsvärde och forma framtiden för SJ.


Vi söker dig som brinner för att förvandla data till insikter och möjligheter. Hos oss får du chansen att forma framtiden som en del av vår resa mot att bli ännu mer datadrivna. Du kommer att utforska, identifiera och frigöra potentialen i SJs data över hela verksamheten med hjälp av traditionell BI, avancerad analys, maskininlärning och AI. Rollen är en nyckel i att skapa värde och innovation som verkligen gör skillnad – både för SJ och våra kunder.


SJs övergripande mål är att bidra till Skandinaviens tillväxt- och klimatmål genom att leverera 50% mer resor till 2030. För att kunna realisera denna tillväxtresa gör vi historiska investeringar på 19 miljarder i nya snabbtåg, nya regionaltåg och uppgraderingar av vår befintliga fordonsflotta.


Som en viktig del av vår spännande resa satsar vi också på vår förmåga att skapa värde genom användning av data och analys. Enheten Data & Analys etablerades 2023 och ska nu skala upp förmågan för att kunna leverera brett inom koncernen. Förmågan är viktig för att framtidssäkra verksamheten och maximera nyttan från större investeringar, inte bara på fordonssidan, utan även i nya IT-system för bland annat boknings- och säljsystem, personalplanering, operativ trafikledning och intelligent fordonsunderhåll.


Din kommande roll

Som Data Scientist blir du en central del av vårt nybildade team Data & Analys. Här får du möjlighet att utvecklas i en roll där du kommer att:


  • Driva spännande projekt från idéstadiet till färdig lösning, med direkt påverkan på företagets framgång
  • Arbeta med hela datahanteringsprocessen, inklusive insamling, förberedelse, modellering och visualisering av data
  • Implementera innovativa lösningar i produktionsmiljöer och hantera stora datamängder för att upptäcka värdefulla insikter
  • Kommunicera dina fynd till olika intressenter och hjälpa till att omvandla tekniska insikter till konkreta affärsstrategier
  • Utforska och experimentera med modern teknik för att förbättra våra processer. Du kommer balansera snabb experimentell utveckling med skapandet av strukturerad och underhållsbar kod för produktion


Enheten Data & Analys är en del av Ekonomifunktionen och arbetar tillsammans med IT-divisionen, samt nära med Strategi & Verksamhetsutveckling och Business Control som båda återfinns inom Ekonomi.


Förväntningar på den vi söker

  • En akademisk examen inom datavetenskap, statistik, matematik, fysik eller liknande område
  • Stark programmeringskompetens i Python och SQL
  • Erfarenhet av molnbaserade miljöer; kunskap om Azure Databricks är ett stort plus
  • Förståelse för agila arbetsmetoder och moderna utvecklingsprinciper som DevOps och CI/CD
  • En analytisk och nyfiken natur, med en passion för att lösa komplexa problem
  • Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och förmåga att göra tekniska koncept begripliga för icke-tekniska intressenter
  • Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift
  • Meriterande är erfarenheter av prediktivt underhåll


Ansökan och information

Urval sker löpande så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, dock senast den 23 januari 2025.


I den här rekryteringen samarbetar SJ med Jefferson Wells och Experis. Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta ansvariga rekryteringskonsulter Malin Magnusson, 076-7806864, malin.magnusson@jeffersonwells.se, och Anki Snis, 0703-775969, anki.snis@se.experis.com.

Title: Data Scientist MMM
Description:
At Nepa, Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM) isn’t just a key focus area; it’s a passion that drives us to deliver exceptional value to our clients. Our advanced analytics empower businesses to optimize their marketing spend, enabling them to make informed, data-driven decisions that truly maximize ROI across all channels.

We’re excited about the future and are actively investing in enhancing our MMM capabilities. By continuously refining our methods and tools, we deliver actionable insights that help our clients succeed.

We’re on the lookout for a Data Scientist who is eager to make a difference by driving Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM) solutions for our clients. If you’re passionate about leveraging data science to tackle complex marketing challenges and delivering valuable insights to over 500 blue-chip companies, this could be the perfect opportunity for you!




Your role as our Data Scientist

As a Data Scientist in our Marketing Mix Modelling team at Nepa, you will work with research and development as well as the implementation of advanced models, with a focus on implementation and delivery of our Marketing Mix Modelling solutions. You will join a brilliant team of Data Scientists, working across Nepa’s core products. You will also be in close contact with other key stakeholders across the company, working together to take our products to the next level.




Your responsibilites:

- Client delivery: You will take lead on our Marketing Mix Modelling deliveries to our clients. This involves everything from data structuring and modelling to presenting technical solutions and results to our clients.

- Advanced analysis: You leverage in-depth technical expertise to help solve our clients’ most demanding problems. Furthermore, are mindful of how technical design choices impact client value.

- Method expert and mentor: You will support our client teams and junior colleagues as an internal and external method expert in our Marketing Mix Modelling solution.

- Participate in product development: You will be part of a cross-functional product team with other data scientists, data engineers and developers. You will help integrate new learnings and insights in the product development as well as improving workflows and processes. We value collaboration and believe that the best products are built when combining different domain expertise’s.

- Staying on top of industry trends: Both tech and marketing are rapidly evolving industries. Nepa takes pride in our position as thought leaders, and places a big focus on staying up-to-date in order to remain one step ahead




Your profile

- Bachelor's/Master’s degree in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Business administration or similar

- Practical experience from working as a data scientist, analytics consultant, or similar role in the industry

- Hands-on experience from working with Marketing Mix Modelling

- You have a business mind-set and are able to turn data and results into actionable insights for our clients

- Excellent story telling and communication skills, ability to explain technical issues and solutions to non-technical people

- Competent in Python

- You are fluent in English, both in writing and speech.

- You have a work permit.

Although not required, previous experience of Bayesian statistics is highly valued.




A few more things

- You share our vision to become the world leading data-to-growth company.

- You live our values daily | We see what others don’t | We love it and it shows | We cut the crap | We care and act accordingly |.

- You take pride in delivering high level of services, we are known for that.




Who are we?

Nepa is a leading provider of marketing optimization solutions. By combining data analytics, technology, and industry expertise, we empower our clients to make informed decisions and drive success. Our innovative solutions enable businesses to understand and connect with their customers, creating lasting relationships and delivering measurable results.




Next step!

We review applications as we receive them, and interviews will be held continuously so please submit your application as soon as possible.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer (Flexible location)

Are you eager to shape the future of our industry together with us? At Seco Tools, we’re looking for an AI Engineer to join us. We welcome you to a people company in the machining business – characterized by a genuine interest in our customers’ success, an inclusive family spirit and personal commitment.

About The Role

As an AI Engineer, you will play a key role in developing and implementing AI-driven solutions across various business functions. You will collaborate closely with stakeholders from different departments to understand their needs, identify opportunities for AI adoption, and build scalable AI applications. Additionally, you will contribute to enhancing our company’s overall AI capabilities—improving our technology stack, refining processes, and upskilling teams. Location for the role is flexible, preferably close to our premises within Europe or India.

Key Responsibilities


Develop & Implement AI Solutions: Work with business units to design, build, and deploy AI/ML models that drive efficiency, automation, and innovation.
Collaborate with Business Stakeholders: Understand business challenges, identify AI opportunities, and translate them into technical solutions.
Enhance AI Capabilities: Improve our AI ecosystem by advancing technologies, refining workflows, and fostering AI literacy within the organization.
Ensure AI Governance & Scalability: Develop robust AI models that align with ethical, legal, and operational standards.
Implement Software Development Best Practices: Follow software engineering principles, including version control, code reviews, CI/CD pipelines, and automated testing.
Stay Ahead of AI Trends: Continuously research emerging AI technologies and best practices to keep our company at the forefront of AI adoption.


About You

We’re looking for someone with proven Experience in AI Implementation: demonstrated ability to develop and implement AI solutions in a business setting, delivering tangible impact. Hands-on experience with lakehouse solutions, preferably Databricks. Strong understanding of software development best practices, DevOps methodologies, CI/CD pipelines, and MLOps for AI model deployment. Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, NLP, computer vision, or other relevant AI technologies. Experience with cloud platforms, preferably Azure. Ability to understand business needs and align AI solutions with strategic goals. We also believe that you have a passion for finding innovative AI-driven solutions to complex challenges and strong interpersonal skills to work with cross-functional teams and present AI concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Acting in a global environment calls for fluency in both verbal and written English

What We Offer

A dynamic and innovative work environment within a leading organization in the cutting tools industry.Opportunities to shape the strategic direction of a key business segment. A collaborative and supportive team culture. Competitive compensation and benefits package. Join us to lead the evolution of our Round Tools business and make a lasting impact on our industry.

Our Seco culture

Seco employees across the globe share our family spirit, along with a passion for our customers and a personal commitment to ensure success in everything we do. For us, it’s also clear that our diversities form an amazing foundation for achieving great results. Visit our LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us and our products further.

Application

Send your application no later than February,5 2025. Read more about us and apply at secotools.com (Job ID: R0067832).

As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.

Contact Information

For further information about this position please contact a member of our project team Praskovia Sheremeteva, Praskovia.sheremeteva@sandvik.com

At Seco Tools we develop and offer advanced products & solutions that make metal cutting easier. We work together with our customers to identify and implement the best solutions for their needs. The corporate culture empowers employees through shared values: Passion for our customers, Family Spirit, Personal commitment. Seco Tools has a presence in more than 75 countries and employs about 4000 people.

Title: SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
Our Purpose

At SAS we are passionate about revolutionizing the aviation industry through cutting-edge technology. We aim to become Scandinavia's preferred airline with your help. As part of our AI Team, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the future of air travel by developing and deploying innovative solutions. If you’re excited about driving machine learning projects to enhance network efficiency, flight operations, and customer experience, this role is for you!

About The Team

SAS is dedicated to a true digital journey, leveraging data and advanced analytics to build the foundation for the future of aviation.

We are a central machine learning team that collaborates closely with stakeholders across various business units, identifying business challenges and opportunities that can be addressed through advanced analytics.

We work with diverse machine learning projects, collaborate and contribute to the machine learning practice to ensure that we have a solid foundation for SAS to scale and fully harness the potential of machine learning.

With our collaborations expanding, we’re looking to secure future success by bringing in an experienced Data Scientist to enhance our team further.

Senior Data Scientist

In this role, you’ll be engaging in diverse machine learning projects and communicating insights and recommendations to business stakeholders.

You will contribute to machine learning practice and data-driven business to ensure a solid foundation for SAS to scale and realize the full potential of machine learning. As a key enabler in the team, you’ll also be involved in tool & infrastructure decisions, collaborate with other teams to utilize synergy effects and ensure best practices in data and cloud infrastructure.

Your primary responsibilities will include translating business questions into analytical requirements and actionable data science use cases, developing machine learning models, and applying innovative analytical approaches to drive business value. As well as guiding our practices and provide mentorship for less experienced data scientists.

You’ll use advanced analytical techniques to provide fresh perspectives on problem-solving, enhance our data-driven strategies, and unlock the full potential of machine learning. Your passion for data and algorithms will thrive in our dynamic, rapidly evolving digital environment, where your curiosity and enthusiasm will solve complex issues and inspire others.

Key Responsibilities


Work closely with the various business divisions within SAS to identify and translate high-level business needs into defined data science projects
Own end-to-end ML projects from ideation to production, working with modern cloud infrastructure and MLOps practices
Support in continuous improvement of methodologies and standards within our Data Science practice
Present data-driven insights and actionable recommendations to business stakeholders
Contribute to innovation within the company by exploring new ways to leverage on ML and data
Mentor and Influence: Guide junior data scientists and advocate for ML best practices across the organization
Horizon scan to stay up to date with the latest technology, algorithms, and methods


To Be Successful, We Believe You Should Have


Master’s Degree or higher with strong mathematics focus (Data Science, Statistics, Econometrics, Applied Mathematics, Optimization, Computer Science) or related field.
At least 5 years of industry experience within Data science domain
Proven record of taking on loosely defined problems and translating into practical application
More than 5 years’ experience with Python, SQL and popular machine/deep learning libraries
Proficient with statistical- and machine learning models (both supervised learning and unsupervised learning)
Well-versed in cloud computing, prior experience with Azure is a big plus
Excellent communication skills


We believe you’re self-driven, persistent, creative, and curious, with a strong passion for learning. You seek to understand both the big picture and the intricate details that make it up. Like us, you get excited by commercial opportunities and proactively strive to create business value!

Why SAS?

Benefits

At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:


Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Central Station, Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.


If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please apply already today with your CV and a short personal letter. Last day for application is February 9th, 2025. For questions relating to this position, please contact responsible Talent Acquisition Specialist, Rakhi, at rakhi.romarker@sas.dk.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Python Developer for a Fast-Growing Startup 🚀




Are you a skilled backend developer looking to make a real impact in an ambitious and fast-paced environment?

As part of their team you'll have the opportunity to help shape a product that genuinely improves people’s everyday lives. 🙌




What You’ll Do

🚀 Enhance and expand their platform.
🤝 Collaborate closely with other developers and key stakeholders to identify and address customer needs.
🛠️ Take ownership of projects, driving both development and improvements.




What They're Looking For

🧠 2–3 years of experience in web development, with strong Python skills.
🔍 An analytical mindset and passion for clean, efficient, and well-documented code.
🌐 A solid understanding of digital transformation and industry modernization.
A bonus: Django development, Open API's and integrations, AWS (or other cloud environments)




Why Join Them?

🎉 Be part of an enthusiastic, collaborative team where your contributions matter.
💡 Join a company culture that values creativity, learning, and mutual support.
🏢 Work from a central location with flexibility to suit your lifestyle.
📈 Access career development opportunities in a rapidly scaling startup.







If you’re excited about being a key player in building something transformative and contributing to a growth journey, we’d love to hear from you! ✨ Send us your CV and portfolio today!

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Senior Python Django Developer - Tech-for-Good / Energy - Stockholm Office - 55,000 SEK - 70,000 SEK




This is the chance to work for a company who are working tirelessly to improve our planet through energy consumption.




This is a company who, for over 10 years, have continued to grow a strong and diverse team that is passionate around making a difference.




After another round of investment, the company is looking to hire in many different areas within the business which of course includes their background Python team. A strong advocacy for people who enjoy taking accountability for their day and enjoy working closely with others on different projects.




There is always a drive for new features and continually looking to improve the product for their customers.




Essentials:




Python - Minimum 4/5 years
Django

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer på Kundo – Driv framtiden för AI inom kundservice

Vill du vara med och driva AI- och teknik-transformationen inom kundservice?

Kundo är ett SaaS-bolag som erbjuder Sveriges mest okrångliga kundservicesystem. Vi arbetar hårt mot målet att bli Nordens ledande helhetsleverantör av digitala kundservice-produkter. Kundservicebranschen förändras snabbt, och framväxande AI-teknologier ger stora möjligheter till effektivisering och innovation. Vi står inför en spännande och ambitiös resa där vi bygger en plattform som driver AI-baserad förändring.




På vår fortsatta tillväxtresa letar vi nu efter en skicklig och visionär AI Engineer som ansluter till vårt fantastiska utvecklingsteam. I denna roll får du en unik möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste AI-tekniken och driva innovation i en föränderlig bransch där kundservice håller på att transformeras helt och hållet.




Rollbeskrivning

Som AI Engineer på Kundo kommer du att ingå i ett tvärfunktionellt team där fokus kommer att vara att utveckla och implementera AI-drivna funktioner för vår produkt.

Du arbetar både med att förbättra och utveckla produktens effektivitet och användarupplevelse genom att införa AI som en naturlig del i hela vår produktlösning, och att utveckla hela bolagets produktstrategi och -erbjudande baserat på AI.

Du kommer att arbeta nära våra UX-designers, produktchefer och andra teammedlemmar, där du leder processen från att identifiera kundbehov till att välja rätt AI-lösning, implementera och optimera dessa, samt mäta effekten av dem.




Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden

Designa, utveckla och underhålla AI-baserade system med hjälp av den senaste tekniken, såsom stora språkmodeller (LLM), Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), AI-agenter och AI-pipelines.
Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för att säkerställa att AI-lösningar är i linje med kundernas behov och verksamhetsmål.
Bidra till att forma Kundos långsiktiga AI-strategi och utveckling.




Vad vi söker

För att trivas i denna roll har du troligtvis följande kvalifikationer:

Minst 5 års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling
Goda kunskaper i Python
Minst 2 års Erfarenhet av att arbeta med modern AI-teknik som stora språkmodeller, AI-pipelines och agenter.
Ett starkt intresse för AI-innovation och erfarenhet av att designa och implementera AI-lösningar.
Meriterande är erfarenhet av data engineering.




Har du några frågor? Hör gärna av dig till Jonatan Larsson på 070-5124424 eller jonatan@kundo.se. Vi hanterar själva rekryteringsprocessen internt och tar inte hjälp av externa partners.

Title: Data Scientist - Sportsbook
Description:
Description

Position at LeoVegas Group

About The Role

The Data Scientist - Sportsbook develops customer, odds modeling, pricing, risk, and other models to support the LeoVegas sportsbook team. The role holder will prepare, train, and deploy innovative predictive models for both batch and realtime use cases that will support business operations and directly impact the sportsbook user experience.

The role will work closely with data scientists, engineers, and analysts, but you will also work regularly with the trading/bookmaking, risk, and other sportsbook operational teams. You will be one of the early members of the team in a highly visible and impactful role as our sportsbook expands its global reach.

YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:


Interpret stakeholder requirements to develop, implement, and fine-tune machine learning models that address their specific needs and business objectives.
Improve and maintain existing machine learning models to enhance their performance, accuracy, and efficiency over time as well as following new regulations.
Collaborate cross-functionally with various teams, including product, engineering, and business, to ensure seamless integration and alignment of machine learning solutions with overall company goals.
Analyse and transform data using SQL to prepare datasets for machine learning model development and ensure data integrity and accuracy.
Conduct A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the effectiveness of new features and promotions.
Collaborate with external parties to enable outsourced ML based applications.
Perform advanced analysis on large and complex datasets to extract actionable insights and inform the business to make informed decisions


OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:

Essential Skills


Understanding of fundamental concepts in statistics and machine learning
Experience in apply machine learning, either in academia or industry
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R.
Experience with SQL
Basic understanding of Git


NICE TO HAVES


Experience in any of the following techniques or systems: Airflow, Bayesian statistics, BigQuery, causal inference, Docker, GitHub, Google Cloud Platform, Kubeflow, natural language processing, neural networks, scikit-learn, Stan, survival analysis, TensorFlow, time-series forecasting, Vertex AI, and XGBoost


Who We Are

At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices worldwide.

Benefits


Hybrid work policy
4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
30 annual vacation days
Occupational Pension
5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
Parental Leave Top-Up
Possibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
1,500 SEK equipment allowance
Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


JOIN US!

In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!

Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!

**As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please**

_________________________________________________________________________________________________

Title: AI/ML Engineer inom Analytics
Description:
Brinner du för artificiell intelligens och maskininlärning? Är du på jakt efter det där avgörande steget som kommer att lyfta din karriär till nya höjder? Då har du hittat rätt!

Hos Avega Data & Analytics letar vi efter just dig – en dedikerad AI/ML-engineer, full av driv och redo att omvandla din tekniska skicklighet till revolutionerande lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad. Missa inte chansen att bli en del av vårt härliga team och forma framtiden med oss!




Vad vi erbjuder:

Vårt mål är att vara den mest utvecklande arbetsplatsen i din karriär. Vårt unika forum för kompetensutveckling – Elevate – har över 70 föreläsningar och workshops om året. Utöver Elevate delar vi kunskap kontinuerligt t ex genom Lunch’n’Learn, ML Hackatons och ett AI labb.




Vår matchningsprincip 1:1 innebär att vi alltid strävar efter 100% matchning mellan våra kompetenser och våra kunders utmaningar – vi är aktivt med och väljer våra konsultuppdrag för att uppnå kontinuerlig utveckling och engagemang. För oss är rätt utmaning för varje individ avgörande för att lyckas i rollen.




Vi återfinns i de flesta branscher i den svenska arbetsmarknaden, och vi väljer gärna kunder och uppdrag som både utvecklar oss som konsulter och som gynnar samhället i stort.




På Avega delar vi generöst med oss av vår kunskap och är alltid redo att lära av varandra, i en atmosfär präglad av ömsesidig respekt och prestigelöshet. Det skapar en familjär och uppmuntrande arbetsmiljö för alla.







Dina kvalifikationer

Teknisk expertis: Starka kunskaper i AI och machine learning-tekniker, inklusive algoritmer, modellering och dataanalys.
Programmering och verktyg: Behärskar programmeringsspråk som Python mycket väl, samt god kunskap om AI-ramverk som TensorFlow eller PyTorch. Arbetserfarenhet av Azure ML, AWS ML och/eller Google Cloud AutoML.
Datahantering: Förmåga att extrahera, rengöra och hantera stora datamängder med verktyg som SQL och Pandas.
Etik och dataskydd: God förståelse för etiska överväganden och dataskyddsregler relaterade till AI-applikationer.
Språk: Goda kunskap i svenska och engelska – både i tal och skrift.
Minst sex års erfarenhet inom domänen, gärna som IT-konsult, data engineer eller liknande.




Utöver de mer tekniska kvalifikationerna lägger vi även stor vikt vid följande kompetenser:




Problemidentifiering och lösning: Skicklighet i att identifiera affärsproblem som kan lösas med AI och utveckla skräddarsydda lösningar.
Kommunikation och presentation: Starka förmågor i att kommunicera tekniska koncept till icke-tekniska stakeholders och att presentera lösningar och framsteg effektivt.
Affärsförståelse: Insikt i hur AI kan skapa värde och driva innovation inom olika affärsområden.




Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din Analytics-karriär och göra en verklig skillnad med dina färdigheter inom AI/ML?




Vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig och utforska hur du kan bidra till vårt team!

  • Affärsförståelse: Insikt i hur AI kan skapa värde och driva innovation inom olika affärsområden.


Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din Analytics-karriär och göra en verklig skillnad med dina färdigheter inom AI/ML?


Vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig och utforska hur du kan bidra till vårt team!

Title: Data Engineer/Scientist
Description:
DATA ENGINEER/SCIENTIST

Är du redo att ta steget? Att utvecklas till nästa nivå! Vi är entreprenörer som har en spännande och utmanande arbetsplats där du kan utvecklas både personligt och professionellt. Kom med på vår resa och hjälp ambitiösa företag att nå sin fulla potential med teknik, data och AI i rollen som Data Engineer/Scientist. Vi söker dig som har lite erfarenhet redan, eller mycket.




Itera Sverige

Itera är en ca. 800 man stark Skandinavisk IT-konsultkoncern. Nyligen startade vi upp vår verksamhet i Stockholm och vi växer stadigt. Samtidigt som vi har en långsiktig och stabil koncern i ryggen är vi på många sätt en start-up i Stockholm och teamet är tight. Vi har fokus på branscherna Energi och Försäkring/Finans, men även andra branscher "bubblar" så som Försvar. Hos oss finner du en inkluderande arbetsmiljö, där mångfald är viktigt och nyfikenhet står i fokus. Vi brinner för att leverera hållbara resultat och göra verklig skillnad med allt vi gör. Ambitionerna är stora för både koncernen och för vår svenska verksamhet. Därför söker vi nu nyfikna teknikentusiaster som vill vara med och forma vår framtid.




Om teamet – personerna du ska arbeta med

Kollegorna på Stockholmskontoret är alla erfarna konsulter. En del jobbar övergripande som affärsarkitekter eller projektledare medan andra har djup teknisk kompetens inom Data Engineering och Data Science. Data, AI och analys/insikt är ett strategiskt område för hela Itera, och vi har arbetat inom detta område i över 15 år. Vår miljö består av drygt 30 konsulter i Skandinavien och vi både jobbar och umgås tvärs alla länder. Itera har lång erfarenhet av att hjälpa företag att skapa värde från data och söker alltid både de tekniska och organisatoriska lösningar som krävs för att lyckas med datadrivna initiativ och investeringar.




Vi letar nu efter fler passionerade teknikentusiaster som vill vara med och forma framtiden för oss och våra kunder. Hos oss hittar du en dynamisk och inkluderande arbetsmiljö, där mångfald och nyfikenhet står i fokus.




Ansvarsområden – vad kommer du jobba med?

Affärsanalys och lösningsdesign: Analysera affärsprocesser och översätta affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar, samt föreslå förbättringar och framtida möjligheter
Dataintegration: Designa, bygga, testa och producera moderna och robusta datapipelines, avancerade ETL-processer, dataströmmar, API:er och visualiseringar
Dataanalys och tillgängliggörande: Hjälpa kunder och kollegor ge råd och implementera verktyg för att tillgängliggöra data och analysera
Dataarkitektur: Beskriva arkitekturer, datalager och databaser som stöder dataåtkomst och avancerad analys, och implementera dem genom moderna visualiseringsverktyg
Utveckla bästa praxis: Bidra till att definiera standarder och bästa praxis för moderna BI- och AI-lösningar
Hjälpa Iteras kunder inom drift, förvaltning och vidareutveckling av deras dataplattformar




Önskade kvalifikationer

Relevant utbildning, gärna på masternivå (relevant erfarenhet räknas också)
Minst 4 års erfarenhet av att leverera i dataprojekt
Eftersom vi främst arbetar i Azure är det önskvärt att du är bekant med plattformen
Erfarenhet av / kunskap om Databricks och/eller MS Fabric
Flytande svenska i tal och skrift, samt goda kunskaper i engelska




Det är en fördel om du har följande

Duktig på att kommunicera, har ett kommersiellt tänk och erfarenhet som konsult
Motivation att ständigt förnya din tekniska kompetens, då branschen är i ständig utveckling
Kunskap om tjänster från andra molnleverantörer än Azure t.ex. (AWS, GCP)
Erfarenhet från branscher som Energi, Finans eller Försvarsindustri
Erfarenhet från ett eller flera av följande områden:
Databehandling (data wrangling, datakvalitetskontroll) för både strukturerad data som tidsserier och ostrukturerad data
Data pipeline design och orkestrering för streaming-data och batch-data
Datamodellering och styrning
Uppsättning av molnbaserad dataplattform
Datarapporterings- och/eller analysprojekt
Skapa teknisk lösningsarkitektur.




Vad vi på Itera kan erbjuda dig

Itera Sverige kan bäst beskrivas som en start-up. Du kommer in i en spännande tillväxtfas där du kan påverka företaget mycket om du vill. Samtidigt tillhör vi en trygg koncern som funnits i 30 år. Vi är knappt 800 teknikexperter, designers, problemlösare, projektledare och organisationsutvecklare som varje dag arbetar för att göra skillnad. Vi är solida och börsnoterade på Oslo-börsen men präglas ändå starkt av entreprenörskap, stora ambitioner och bra möjligheter att nå dem. De senaste fem åren har vi röstats fram i Norge som ett av de mest innovativa företagen, oavsett bransch.




Vi har konkurrenskraftiga villkor med bra försäkringar och pensionsplaner. Vi har både aktieprogram och bonussystem för de anställda.




Om du är som oss och gillar att göra skillnad, gillar att engagera dig, är mån om ständigt lärande och att dela kunskap samt tycker att en start-up verkar spännande, då hoppas vi att du bjuder in dig själv till en informell pratstund med oss.




Skicka ditt CV och en kort ansökan till oss och följ med på vårt äventyr!

Kollegorna på Stockholmskontoret är alla erfarna konsulter. En del jobbar övergripande som affärsarkitekter eller projektledare medan andra har djup teknisk kompetens inom Data Engineering och Data Science. Data, AI och analys/insikt är ett strategiskt område för hela Itera, och vi har arbetat inom detta område i över 15 år. Vår miljö består av drygt 30 konsulter i Skandinavien och vi både jobbar och umgås tvärs alla länder. Itera har lång erfarenhet av att hjälpa företag att skapa värde från data och söker alltid både de tekniska och organisatoriska lösningar som krävs för att lyckas med datadrivna initiativ och investeringar.


Vi letar nu efter fler passionerade teknikentusiaster som vill vara med och forma framtiden för oss och våra kunder. Hos oss hittar du en dynamisk och inkluderande arbetsmiljö, där mångfald och nyfikenhet står i fokus.


Ansvarsområden – vad kommer du jobba med?

  • Affärsanalys och lösningsdesign: Analysera affärsprocesser och översätta affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar, samt föreslå förbättringar och framtida möjligheter
  • Dataintegration: Designa, bygga, testa och producera moderna och robusta datapipelines, avancerade ETL-processer, dataströmmar, API:er och visualiseringar
  • Dataanalys och tillgängliggörande: Hjälpa kunder och kollegor ge råd och implementera verktyg för att tillgängliggöra data och analysera
  • Dataarkitektur: Beskriva arkitekturer, datalager och databaser som stöder dataåtkomst och avancerad analys, och implementera dem genom moderna visualiseringsverktyg
  • Utveckla bästa praxis: Bidra till att definiera standarder och bästa praxis för moderna BI- och AI-lösningar
  • Hjälpa Iteras kunder inom drift, förvaltning och vidareutveckling av deras dataplattformar


Önskade kvalifikationer

  • Relevant utbildning, gärna på masternivå (relevant erfarenhet räknas också)
  • Minst 4 års erfarenhet av att leverera i dataprojekt
  • Eftersom vi främst arbetar i Azure är det önskvärt att du är bekant med plattformen
  • Erfarenhet av / kunskap om Databricks och/eller MS Fabric
  • Flytande svenska i tal och skrift, samt goda kunskaper i engelska


Det är en fördel om du har följande

  • Duktig på att kommunicera, har ett kommersiellt tänk och erfarenhet som konsult
  • Motivation att ständigt förnya din tekniska kompetens, då branschen är i ständig utveckling
  • Kunskap om tjänster från andra molnleverantörer än Azure t.ex. (AWS, GCP)
  • Erfarenhet från branscher som Energi, Finans eller Försvarsindustri
  • Erfarenhet från ett eller flera av följande områden:
  • Databehandling (data wrangling, datakvalitetskontroll) för både strukturerad data som tidsserier och ostrukturerad data
  • Data pipeline design och orkestrering för streaming-data och batch-data
  • Datamodellering och styrning
  • Uppsättning av molnbaserad dataplattform
  • Datarapporterings- och/eller analysprojekt
  • Skapa teknisk lösningsarkitektur.


Vad vi på Itera kan erbjuda dig

Itera Sverige kan bäst beskrivas som en start-up. Du kommer in i en spännande tillväxtfas där du kan påverka företaget mycket om du vill. Samtidigt tillhör vi en trygg koncern som funnits i 30 år. Vi är knappt 800 teknikexperter, designers, problemlösare, projektledare och organisationsutvecklare som varje dag arbetar för att göra skillnad. Vi är solida och börsnoterade på Oslo-börsen men präglas ändå starkt av entreprenörskap, stora ambitioner och bra möjligheter att nå dem. De senaste fem åren har vi röstats fram i Norge som ett av de mest innovativa företagen, oavsett bransch.


Vi har konkurrenskraftiga villkor med bra försäkringar och pensionsplaner. Vi har både aktieprogram och bonussystem för de anställda.


Om du är som oss och gillar att göra skillnad, gillar att engagera dig, är mån om ständigt lärande och att dela kunskap samt tycker att en start-up verkar spännande, då hoppas vi att du bjuder in dig själv till en informell pratstund med oss.


Skicka ditt CV och en kort ansökan till oss och följ med på vårt äventyr!

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Location: Stockholm (hybrid / min. 2 days per week)




Amberes are partnered with a Nordic based AI SaaS business, partnered with some of the biggest names in industry from Google, to SAP, Workday, Okta, Snowflake & more, who have developed a market leading knowledge management platform.




With over 200 employees, over $100m in funding & operating across 3 regions our client are now embarking on a strengthening phase for 2025.




We are supporting them in their search for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer who can come in, hit the ground running and support the business in building scalable backend systems for their core product suite.




You will be responsible for:




Designing and building a scalable RAG system as a platform
Developing and optimising retrieval algorithms & generation models
Developing & maintaining data & AI infrastructure
Creating data pipelines for indexing large volumes of documentation
Guiding and mentoring existing teams and colleagues where needed




Technical Requirements




We are specifically seeking somebody with 5+ years professional experience in the following areas:




AI or Machine Learning background
Experience working with LLMs, NLP or RAG
General Software Engineering experience, particularly on the backend. Experience in Node.js (Typescript) or Kotlin is strongly preferred
Experience building machine learning pipelines




This is a fully hands role, that requires somebody with a passion for engineering day to day.

If you are driven by purpose and have the passion to work in the area of AI for the long term future, then we look forward to receiving your application.

Title: AI Engineer for autonomous systems
Description:
Join us now!

Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.

Are you passionate about creating and implementing deep learning data pipelines, CI/CD, cloud technology, and neural networks for autonomous driving? Are you eager to use academic knowledge and coding skills to solve real-world problems? Do you possess a strong technical background and thrive in a dynamic work environment? The Autonomous Systems department in Scania R&D is seeking a talented and motivated AI Engineer to join the AI Foundation team.

The team’s complex and fun mission is to seamlessly find a safe, comfortable, and eco-friendly trajectory for our autonomous vehicles. We consider various constraints, including the vehicle's physical limitations, traffic rules, and collision avoidance. Machine learning technologies can be of considerable assistance for this intricate challenge. Together with your team, you will research, develop, and create large-scale deep-learning data workflows, and optimize models for performance and scalability. Join us and enjoy the ride together with us!

Your responsibilities

You will work with industrial research and pre-development in a collaborative and agile multi-cultural team within Scania R&D, and your focus will be to develop, test, and run data pipelines in production at a large scale. The team’s responsibility spans from architectural designs, via software development to concept evaluation, as being part of a more intelligent transportation system.

As part of this role, you will also:



Train, test, and deploy machine learning models on the cloud
Collaborate cross-functionally between teams to understand requirements, and design optimal and robust data pipelines
Stay up to date with the very growing field of AI



Your profile

Our team is diverse with a mix of backgrounds and experiences. We are result-oriented, self-driven, and face new challenges with a positive, can-do attitude. To enjoy working with us we believe you are open and curious towards your teammates, communicative, can inspire others, supportive, and contribute to the development with your technical expertise.

Furthermore, we think you have the experience and knowledge in the following:



MSc/PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Robotics, or related technical field of study
Implementing data pipelines to train deep learning models, integrating large-scale data workflows, and optimizing models for performance and scalability
Python and deep learning (using PyTorch or TensorFlow), as well as basic knowledge of SQL
Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) and unit/integration testing
Cloud technology such as EC2, IaM, infrastructure-as-code tools (IaC) such as Terraform



Experience with the following is meritorious:



Distributed training of deep learning models
Foundation models, generative models, large language models (LLM), and visual language models (VLM).
Observability tools for logging and monitoring, such as Grafana and AWS CloudWatch.
Databricks and Apache Spark, including Spark SQL, DataFrame API, and Spark Streaming.
Distributed storage systems like AWS S3 and storage formats like Delta tables and Parquet.
Data modeling concepts (Bronze, Silver, Gold layered architecture), ETL processes, performing data cleansing, and ensuring data quality throughout the pipeline.
Publications in top-tier conferences or journals related to machine learning



If you possess some (not necessarily all) of the requirements mentioned, we encourage you to apply with confidence. Every application is valued, and we welcome you to join us on this exciting journey of sustainability-driven innovation. Your unique skills and experience could be a perfect fit for our team!

We offer

At Scania ATS Research & Pre-Development we want you to succeed and develop because together with your team you contribute to a sustainable future securing a leading position for Scania in the industry.

Working at Scania you are offered benefits such as hybrid working, mutual performance bonus, flexible working hours, parental leave covered up to 90%, and much more.

For Scania, diversity and inclusion is a strategic necessity. By having employees with the widest possible range of skills, knowledge, backgrounds, and experiences, we ensure we have the right people and together with an inclusive corporate culture this drives our business forward. We call this unique, systemic approach Skill Capture, and it’s a key element of our People Sustainability strategy for Scania’s 52,000 employees worldwide.

Contact information

For more information, you are welcome to contact Maria Linnarsson, Head of AI Technologies, at maria.linnarsson@scania.com.

Application

If you feel you have the skills and desire to take on this interesting and challenging role, please apply by answering the screening questions, and submitting your CV, transcript of records, and relevant certificates. A background check might be conducted for this position. The last day to submit your application is 2025-02-10. Applications will be evaluated continuously.

We are looking forward to reading your application!

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
We’re looking for a Senior Data Scientist to design, deploy, and optimize ML models that drive automation and impact key areas like credit risk and fraud detection. Join us to shape the future of ML at Froda!







About Froda

Froda was founded in 2015 with a clear mission – to democratize the access to financing and provide small businesses the same opportunities to grow as large ones. Through digital processes and technological innovation, we have shortened the loan process from months to minutes, making it easy and affordable for business owners to invest in their ideas. Our objective approach champions diversity, ensures fair terms, and ultimately enables more small businesses to make a positive impact on society.




Join our team and contribute to giving small businesses the opportunity to invest in their ideas to the best possible terms.




Your Impact

Lead the design, development, and deployment of machine learning models to drive automation and efficiency across areas like credit risk, fraud detection, AML, customer service, and business analytics. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to build scalable, robust solutions that support Froda’s strategic goals of scalability, standardization, and reliability.




What You'll Do

Design, build, and deploy ML models and pipelines for critical business areas.
Collaborate with product, engineering, and analytics teams to deliver scalable AI solutions.
Lead data science projects, champion best practices, and support the growth of Froda’s ML/AI capabilities.
Implement and optimize ML-Ops workflows (data processing, model training, deployment, and monitoring.




What You'll Bring

5+ years as a Data Scientist or ML Engineer in tech, fintech, or a similar product-driven company.
Hands-on experience with production ML pipelines, ML-Ops frameworks, and cloud platforms (e.g., Azure).
Proven skills in Python, SQL, and ML libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, etc.).
Experience with LLMs (e.g., GPT APIs, fine-tuning, prompt engineering, RAG).
Knowledge of credit risk, fraud detection, or AML is a plus.




Who You Are

Results-driven problem solver with a passion for impact through data and AI.
Strategic thinker who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Strong communicator, able to break down complex ideas into clear insights.
Collaborative team player, driving innovation and knowledge-sharing across the business.




What’s in it for you?

Working at Froda means working at a company that combines the best of both worlds – fun and fast-paced culture, yet stable and structured. We are 90+ ambitious self-starters who genuinely care for each other and the work we do, while having fun together. You will have the ability to impact your own work and that the only thing standing between you and your goals is going to be your own ambitions.




Furthermore, you’ll get:

Fabulous office overlooking Stockholm and a friendly culture that values work/life balance.
We prioritize working in the office to maximize the positive impact of in-person collaboration, but we offer flexibility with work hours and remote work.
Competitive compensation package
Insurance and pension plan




Be part of a growing team where your work directly impacts the company’s success. Join us in driving meaningful change through AI and machine learning.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer II - Personalization
Description:
The Personalization team makes deciding what to play next easier and more enjoyable for every listener. From Blend to Discover Weekly, we’re behind some of Spotify’s most-loved features. We built them by understanding the world of music and podcasts better than anyone else. Join us and you’ll keep millions of users listening by making great recommendations to each and every one of them. We ask that our team members be physically located in the Central European time zone for the purposes of our collaboration hours.

We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer (MLE II) to join our product area of hardworking engineers that are passionate about connecting new and emerging creators with users via recommendation algorithms. As an integral part of the squad, you will collaborate with engineers, research scientists, and data in prototyping and productizing innovative ML models that allow us to find the right audience for content that is strategically important, such as fresh or timely content.

What You'll Do


Develop and implement production systems that enrich and improve our listeners’ experience on the platform
Contribute to designing, building, evaluating, shipping, and refining Spotify’s product by hands-on ML development
Help drive optimization, testing, and tooling to improve quality of our recommendations
Perform data analysis to establish baselines and advise product decisions
Collaborate with a multi-functional agile team spanning tech research, data science, product management, and engineering to build new technologies and features
Stay up-to-date on the latest machine learning algorithms and techniques


Who You Are


You have professional experience in applied machine learning
Extensive experience working in a product and data-driven environment (Python, Scala, Java, SQL, or C++, with Python experience required) and cloud platforms (GCP or AWS)
You have some hands-on experience implementing or prototyping machine learning systems at scale
You have experience architecting data pipelines and are self-sufficient in getting the data you need to build and evaluate models, using tools like Dataflow, Apache Beam, or Spark
You care about agile software processes, data-driven development, reliability, and disciplined experimentation
You have experience and passion for encouraging collaborative teams
Experience with TensorFlow, pyTorch, and/or other scalable Machine learning frameworks
Experience with building data pipelines and getting the data you need to build and evaluate your models, using tools like Apache Beam / Spark


Where You'll Be


This role is based in Sweden or London
We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

Title: AI-Powered Test Suite Generation for Software Applications
Description:
High Level Description

Software testing is a critical component of the development process, ensuring the quality and reliability of applications. However, creating comprehensive test suites is often time-consuming, labor-intensive, and prone to human error. As software systems grow in complexity, there is an increasing need for more efficient and effective testing methods. AI-powered test suite generation presents a promising solution to streamline the testing process, potentially improving both efficiency and coverage while reducing the burden on human testers.

Project Description

The Primary Objective Of This Project Is To Develop An AI Model Capable Of Automatically Generating Effective Test Suites For Software Applications. The Research Will Explore Various AI Approaches And Evaluate Their Performance In Creating High-quality Test Cases. The Project Will Involve The Following Key Components

Compile a diverse dataset of software specifications, requirements, and corresponding test suites.

Investigate and implement different AI techniques for test suite generation, including but not limited to:


Large Language Models
Genetic Algorithms
Reinforcement Learning approaches
Custom neural network architectures


Train the selected AI models on the curated dataset, experimenting with various hyperparameters and training strategies to optimize performance.

Develop a system that takes software specifications as input and generates comprehensive test suites using the trained AI model.

Assess the quality of the AI-generated test suites.

Who are we looking for?

Bachelor/Master of Science in Computer Science/Engineering

Purpose

The purpose of this research is to advance the field of automated software testing by exploring the potential of AI in generating high-quality test suites. This could potentially contribute to the broader discussion on the role of AI in software engineering and quality assurance.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - ML Planning
Description:
RaySearch is expanding in the field of machine learning to improve cancer care and is looking for a machine learning engineer to join our head office in Stockholm. Joining our team provides you with a unique opportunity to innovate and develop software that improves the lives of cancer patients around the world.

About The Position

You will be part of an agile team developing innovative solutions using machine learning (ML) algorithms to automate and support the process of improving future cancer treatments.

As a member of the ML Planning team, you will develop deep learning models for medical image analysis to be deployed at cancer clinics, helping them automating their treatment planning process. You will work closely with medical physicists and radiation oncologists and you'll incorporate their domain expertise into model architectures and validation approaches.

Your focus will extend beyond initial development to optimization of model performance, balancing prediction accuracy with clinical deployment requirements. You'll implement rigorous testing and validation frameworks to ensure model reliability in clinical settings, while leading code reviews and maintaining high standards for documentation and reproducibility.

Your profile

We think that you are passionate about machine learning techniques and algorithms with a strong drive to develop and assess innovative solutions.

We're looking for someone with proven experience developing production-grade ML systems using PyTorch or TensorFlow, and expertise in processing and analyzing image data. Experience with ML deployment pipelines, model serving architectures, and ML experiment tracking tools are a plus.

Delivering high quality results is something you take pride in, and you thrive in a dynamic and fast paced environment. You are a strong team player who takes responsibility and contributes to a positive atmosphere and you are passionate about developing software for health care professionals and their patients.

Requirements



Ph.D. or M.Sc. in computer science/machine learning or equivalent
Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms
3+ years’ experience of implementing machine learning solutions
Strong programming skills in Python
Experience using deep learning libraries such as TensorFlow or PyTorch
Solid knowledge of data structures, statistics and applied mathematics
Experience training deep learning models for computer vision
Excellent spoken and written communication skills in English



Meriting



Experience using tools for MLOps
Experience in healthcare / medtech



Our Culture

Culture at RaySeach is the driving force behind our organization, where everything we do is driven by a shared passion for innovation and the fight against cancer. Our dedication is reflected in our ability to deliver exceptional results, pay close attention to detail, and consistently go the extra mile. Our employees stand out as experts in their field, driven by a relentless focus on solving problems - no matter how complex. At RaySearch, we take pride in leading the way in cancer treatment, leveraging cutting-edge technology to develop innovative solutions that make a real difference in patient care.

Our Offer

At RaySearch, we offer a diverse and inclusive work environment, fostering openness, sincerity, and collaboration. Located in Hagastaden, Stockholm's Life Science Hub, our modern and creative workspace includes an in-house gym, yoga, and social activities like ping pong, table football, and regular after-work events. Our bistro serves a fantastic lunch buffet, and we offer morning- and afternoon-fika every day. Our rooftop terrace also provides a stunning 360-degree view of Stockholm, enhancing the work experience. All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package.

Application

Apply for the position through the application form below. Please note that we are approaching the holiday season. A response to your application may be delayed until January.
Show more

You will be part of an agile team developing innovative solutions using machine learning (ML) algorithms to automate and support the process of improving future cancer treatments.

Title: AI Developer
Description:
Do you want to be part of a team that is developing tomorrow's businesses and

organizations? At PwC Sweden, we share a common goal of contributing to something bigger than ourselves by building trust and transparency, making positive change, and creating long-term sustainable value. Together, we create a meaningful and rewarding career for you.

Become a part of PwC’s Internal Firm Services

As an employee within PwC's business support, you play an important role in ensuring that the organization operates smoothly and efficiently and delivers value to our clients and stakeholders. Within business support, there are six units that collaborate to support internal operations. We work with everything from communications, marketing, human resources, and IT to finance, procurement, risk management, and quality assurance. By coordinating and collaborating within these various departments, the organization can leverage our specialized knowledge to support and improve operations on a larger scale.

Are you our new colleague in the fast growing AI team?

Are you passionate about AI and eager to make a tangible impact? We are looking for a data scientist who excels in collaboration and enjoys building strong relationships with colleagues to ideate and develop exciting AI solutions. You are naturally curious and adaptable, finding joy in solving complex problems. You take pride in your personal responsibility and are driven to achieve outstanding results.

We offer opportunities for your continuous professional growth, supported by the

collaborative environment within the work environment you're part of. A strong

inclination to collaboration is essential, as you will often work in diverse environments and support different business units.

Your Main Tasks Would Include


Lead the deployment and continuous maintenance of machine learning models


and AI solutions, ensuring high performance and effectiveness in solving

business challenges.


Assist in the design and development of machine learning models and AI


solutions to address business problems.


Assist in the development and maintenance of product pipelines.
Stay current with the latest advancements and industry trends in AI, and apply


them to improve existing processes.


Participate in training sessions and workshops to enhance skills and knowledge,


fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement.

Qualifications For The Position


Relevant education, preferably in Computer Science, Data Science,


Mathematics, Electronics or a related field.


Proficiency in Python.
Practical understanding of generative AI frameworks (vector databases,


LangChain frameworks, OpenAI frameworks,etc).


Experience working with technical requirements, development, testing, etc.
Experience implementing machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g.,


scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).


Excellent communication, presentation and collaboration skills.
Ability to work effectively and adapt to diverse and dynamic environments.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in both spoken and written English.
Collaborate with the global PwC network to identify opportunities for AI


innovations and drive the implementation of new technologies and

methodologies to PwC Sweden.

,

Recruitment Process

We will review applications continuously, and the position may be filled earlier than the application deadline.

Please Attach The Following Documents To Your Application


CV
Cover letter


We believe in having a recruitment process that applies to everyone. As part of the selection, we use psychometric tests to ensure an objective, unbiased, and fair selection. The tests are the first step in our selection process. You will receive a link to these tests after we have received your application.

We value the personal meeting to understand the value you can bring to PwC and what we can offer you. The interview process usually consists of multiple stages and various types of interviews. When meeting with HR, you will have a competency-based interview where we examine the personality test you completed before the interview. During the interview with the business, you will have the opportunity to meet with the relevant team to discuss the role. We call for interviews continuously, and we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

Read more about who we are, and how we are safeguarding inclusion and diversity through our recruiting at www.pwc.se/karriar.

Do you have questions? Let us know!

Questions relating to the job will be answered by Nithin Virinchipuram,

nithin.virinchipuram@pwc.com

If you instead have questions about the recruitment process or your application, reach out to the recruiter: Alexandra Lindskoog, alexandra.lindskoog@pwc.com
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
B3 Link, som är en del av B3-koncernen, är bland annat unika genom vår expertis inom AI-tillämpningar och förmåga att leverera projekt till våra kunder. Vi kombinerar teknik och affärsbehov, och tar ansvar för hela projektcykeln – från business case till implementering av AI-lösningar.

Om rollen

Nu söker vi dig som har erfarenhet inom maskininlärning! Att vara anställd på B3 Link innebär att du hjälper våra kunder i deras utvecklingsprojekt och dagliga utmaningar. Vi ser gärna att du har vana att arbeta såväl självständigt som kundnära och är van vid ett agilt teambaserat arbetssätt.

Vi letar efter dig som har:


Minst 5 års dokumenterad arbetserfarenhet inom maskininlärning eller liknande område
Erfarenhet av att utveckla och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller
Gedigen erfarenhet inom minst ett programmeringsspråk (te.x. Python, Scala eller R)
Erfarenhet av SQL och databashantering
Erfarenhet av dataanalys- och visualiseringsverktyg så som Pandas, Matplotlib
Kunskap om maskininlärningsbibliotek som TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn
Behärskar god svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


Vad vi erbjuder:

Att vi trivs tillsammans på B3 Link är otroligt viktigt. Anledningen till att många börjar hos oss är bland annat det stora fokuset på kompetensutveckling, där vi kontinuerligt delar kunskap med varandra och uppmuntrar till kompetensutveckling och certifieringar. Vi erbjuder bland annat:


Generös kompetensutveckling
Attraktiv lönemodell
En fantastisk wellness- och medarbetarsatsning


Om B3

B3 Link är en del av B3-koncernen. B3 är en börsnoterad koncern och trygg arbetsgivare med hög medarbetarnöjdhet. B3 har ca 1000 medarbetare inom många olika expertområden. B3 är rankad som Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsplats 2021 av Great Place to Work, utsett till Sveriges IT Karriärföretag 2022 och 2023, samt vann utmärkelsen Årets Karriärföretag 2022. Vi lever efter våra värdeord erfarenhet, olikheter och energi samt satsar på hållbarhet i alla led. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra presterar bättre och har därför B3 Team som anordnar aktiviteter inom wellness, från yoga och löpning till musikquiz och föreläsningar om stresshantering och mental hälsa.

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!

Har du frågor om tjänsten? Tveka inte att kontakta rekryteringsansvarig, Petra, för denna tjänst på petra.magnusson@b3.se
Show more

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Location: Stockholm (hybrid / min. 2 days per week)




Amberes are partnered with a Nordic based AI SaaS business, partnered with some of the biggest names in industry from Google, to SAP, Workday, Okta, Snowflake & more, who have developed a market leading knowledge management platform.




With over 200 employees, over $100m in funding & operating across 3 regions our client are now embarking on a strengthening phase for 2025.




We are supporting them in their search for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer who can come in, hit the ground running and support the business in building scalable backend systems for their core product suite.




You will be responsible for:




Designing and building a scalable RAG system as a platform
Developing and optimising retrieval algorithms & generation models
Developing & maintaining data & AI infrastructure
Creating data pipelines for indexing large volumes of documentation
Guiding and mentoring existing teams and colleagues where needed




Technical Requirements




We are specifically seeking somebody with 5+ years professional experience in the following areas:




AI or Machine Learning background
Experience working with LLMs, NLP or RAG
General Software Engineering experience, particularly on the backend. Experience in Node.js (Typescript) or Kotlin is strongly preferred
Experience building machine learning pipelines




This is a fully hands role, that requires somebody with a passion for engineering day to day.

If you are driven by purpose and have the passion to work in the area of AI for the long term future, then we look forward to receiving your application.

Show more

  • Designing and building a scalable RAG system as a platform

  • Developing & maintaining data & AI infrastructure
  • Creating data pipelines for indexing large volumes of documentation
  • Guiding and mentoring existing teams and colleagues where needed

  • General Software Engineering experience, particularly on the backend. Experience in Node.js (Typescript) or Kotlin is strongly preferred
  • Experience building machine learning pipelines


This is a fully hands role, that requires somebody with a passion for engineering day to day.

If you are driven by purpose and have the passion to work in the area of AI for the long term future, then we look forward to receiving your application.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
About Us

At Leya, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.

You are joining an early stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Bird & Bird, Pérez-Llorca, and Mannheimer Swartling. Backed by over $35M in funding from top investors including Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, and top tier law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.

The role

Are you ready to take your AI career to the next level? At Leya, we’re on a mission to revolutionize the legal industry with cutting-edge AI and LLM tech. We’re seeking an AI Engineer to join our face-moving team, where you’ll work on technically difficult projects with the support of an amazing team, and help redefine how legal professionals work.

What you will be doing:


Architect and implement all AI and LLM features at Leya
Ensure we utilize the latest and greatest LLM features, agentic tools etc
Take ownership of our codebase, balancing high-quality code, security and speed of development
Own and drive forward PoCs and solve broad technical challenges


Who you are


A passionate software engineer with a few years of experience implementing and evaluating AI and LLM applications
A strong coder: Proficient in languages like Python, with an emphasis on clean, efficient, and maintainable code.
You’re autonomous and take pride in the systems you architect
You’re a low ego, true team player
You’re a problem solver who’s not afraid to come up with creative solutions and think holistically about applied AI


What's in it for you


Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


We founded Leya with the vision of giving lawyers the tools they deserve.

We didn't build Leya for how law is practiced today; we built it for how it should be practiced tomorrow.
